name: Building the Future: Charter Cities, Network States & More @ Ârc Austin, with Patri Friedman & More
content: Explore EventsSign InHosted ByJames of ÂrcContact the HostReport EventCryptoFeatured in SXSWBuilding the Future: Charter Cities, Network States & More @ Ârc Austin, with Patri Friedman & MoreHosted by James of ÂrcCapital FactoryAustin, TexasGet TicketsWelcome! Please choose your desired ticket type:1-Day Summit Access Guaranteed access to the 1-day summit on frontier tech. No access to the other days of the summit, or to Ârc.Full 3-Day Summit Access Guaranteed access to the entire 3-day Ârc Summit. No access to Ârc outside the summit.Ârc Summit + Full Access​Require Approval Guaranteed access to the entire Ârc Experience: the 3-day summit + full access to Ârc through March. Get TicketYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​Building the Future: Charter Cities, Network States & more, with @patrissimo , @PronomosVC, @ProsperaGlobal, @JacksonSteger & more. ​Governments have achieved much, but struggle to innovate and adapt as the pace of change surges as technology advances. How do governments innovate? How do we improve governance? How do we test and prove that there might be better models to run our villages, cities and countries by?​Join us in Austin to discuss and answer these questions, with incredible speakers at the forefront of these issues actively investing and building in the space, including:​Patri Friedman - General Partner Pronomos VC (number one global investor in charter cities), Founder Seasteading Institute​Jackson Steger - Founding Director, The Network State and the Network School - working with Balaji's to build their city​Trey Goff - Chief of Staff, Prospera (a Charter City in Honduras backed by Coinbase and more), and Executive Director, the Freedom Cities Coalition (working on the new charter cities legislation in the US under Trump)​Mac Davis - founder of Minicircle, and member of Frontier Foundation (also working on the US charter cities legislation)​James of Ârc - founder of Ârc, running Ârc Austin as part of their roadmap to a Charter City.​1pm Doors open​At the Ârc Embassy, Downtown Austin, at 701 Brazos Street and Capital Factory. ​This single-day event is part of the 3-day Ârc Summit, happening March 3-5 in Austin, TX. ​Tickets for this day do not constitute access to the entire Ârc summit, nor grant access to the Ârc Austin Residency running for the month of March. LocationCapital Factory701 Brazos St, Austin, TX 78701, USAHosted ByJames of ÂrcContact the HostReport EventCryptoWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: FINN Partners X humble ventures: Future of Education Day
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byFINN X Humble VenturesSubscribeHosted ByEmily EmburyMarina StenosContact the HostReport EventAIWellnessFeatured in SXSWFINN Partners X humble ventures: Future of Education DayFINN X Humble VenturesAtelier 1205Austin, TexasRegistrationWelcome! To join the event, please register below. Registration closes at  RegisterYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​A Day of Innovation in Education:​9:25 - 9:30 AM: Welcome || Opening Remarks​Marina Stenos, Managing Partner, FINN Partners​Emily Embury, Senior Partner, FINN Partners​​9:30 - 10:15 AM: Equipping the Workforce of Tomorrow with Resilience, Hope, and Belonging​Moderator: Scott Wortman, Senior Director, Communications, Battelle for Kids​Speakers:​Beth Silveira, Former WCPSS Senior Director, Innovative and Strategic Initiatives; Senior Director, Battelle for Kids​Sara Stockwell, Former Perrysburg Schools Executive Director of Pupil Services; Senior Director, Battelle for Kids​As the demands of the future workforce evolve, schools are recognizing the need to go beyond teaching academic and technical skills by fostering durable skills like adaptability, communication, and critical thinking. This panel will explore how integrating these essential competencies into core subjects such as math, science, and reading not only prepares students for career success, but also nurtures their personal well-being. Join education experts as they highlight the critical importance of cultivating hope, resilience, and a sense of belonging in students—qualities that are foundational for long-term success.​​10:15 - 11:00 AM: Leveraging Technology for the Future of Higher Education​Speaker: Nuno Fernandes, President, American Public University System​AI and related technologies can be catalysts to more personalized and immersive learning experiences. Higher education leaders must embrace these changes now, in responsible ways, in order to continue making positive contributions to society as a whole. In his presentation, Nuno Fernandes will highlight how technology is rapidly transforming the way students learn – and what this means for the future of higher education. This dynamic presentation will focus on:​How education has evolved over time, and how it will change in the next several years;​How AI itself is improving its value for students;​AI’s potential impact for society and education in particular; ​Realistic use cases for AI in education​11:00 - 11:30 AM: Communications in the Age of Education Disruption​Diana Marszalek, Global Head of News, PRovoke Media​Liz Willen, Executive Editor, The Hechinger Report​A one-on-one conversation between two leading journalists concerning the future of education in 2025. We anticipate a spirited and insightful discussion between the two editors of marquee outlets, PRovoke Media and The Hechinger Report, focused on the impact the new administration will have on education in the U.S. and globally. As we navigate a series of tectonic shifts—everything from AI to workforce readiness, changes in the teaching labor force to education technology coming into its own, major disruptions in higher education and long-established policy priorities—how will the sector continue to find relevance and authority with key audiences and influencers? This 30-minute discussion will illuminate the power of storytelling and high-quality journalism as well as the importance of trusted brands and voices at this unique moment.​11:30 AM - 12:30 PM: Lunch with Food Truck​12:45 - 1:30 PM: The State of K-12 Cybersecurity in 2025 & Navigating Top Threats​Speaker: Randy Rose, VP of Security Operations and Intelligence, The Center for Internet SecurityCyber attacks on K-12 institutions have become an inevitable reality; a staggering 82% of K-12 organizations experienced cyber incidents over the last 18 months. Between bad actors, malware, and now the rise of AI, education institutions have to be more vigilant than ever in their cybersecurity strategy. The Center for Internet Security will unpack findings from their latest cybersecurity report, assessing the K-12 threat landscape. Learn about top threats, concerns, and the most effective strategies in navigating these threats to keep your school, students, and data safe from cyber attacks.​​1:30 - 2:15 PM: Empowering Learners to Collaborate with AI (Carnegie Mellon University College of Engineering)​Speakers:​Jonathan Cagan, David and Susan Coulter Head of Mechanical Engineering and Associate Director of the Human+AI Design Initiative​Christopher McComb, Gerard G. Elia Associate Professor of Mechanical Engineering and Director of the Human+AI Design Initiative​AI is changing the way that we learn and practice STEM. Intelligent systems can provide real-time feedback to learners and are increasingly important in scientific innovation. Increasingly, students are learning how to use AI tools in the classroom. However, it is not sufficient to prepare students to simply master reactive AI tools. Instead, we also need to prepare them to be excellent collaborators with the proactive AI systems of tomorrow. In doing so, this session will emphasize the role of humans as central—not secondary—to drive effectiveness in the AI-enabled future, and the mandate for education to prepare practitioners for this new normal. By reimagining education through the lens of human-AI collaboration, we aim to equip students with the skills and mindset needed to thrive in an increasingly AI-driven world.​2:15 - 3:00 PM: Guardians of Democracy: Libraries Ensure Information Access​Moderator: Jennifer Leitman, CMO, OverDrive​Speakers:​Skip Dye, SVP, Library Sales and Digital Strategy, Penguin Random House​Lisa Varga, Executive Director, Virginia Library Association​Join us for an insightful session exploring the vital connection between literacy, access, and democracy. Libraries cultivate informed citizens through literacy and upskill programs that foster critical thinking, media literacy and civic participation. Learn how libraries are serving as indispensable hubs for lifelong learning and community empowerment for everyone as one of the most trusted local resources.​​3:00 - 3:45 PM: The Ripple Effect: How Teacher PD Shapes the Future STEM Workforce​Moderator: Jeremy Anderson, CEO, National Math and Science Initiative​Speakers:​Robin Johnson Ford MBA, M. Ed. Director, Advanced Academics & Gifted and Talented, Desoto ISD​Andy Smith, Director, Giving & Volunteering at Texas Instruments; Executive Director, TI Foundation​Dr. Kristen Vesely, Director of Advanced Academics, Ector County ISD​Our country relies on the next generation to fill STEM jobs—but how can we make that a reality when students often shy away from STEM and educators lack the confidence and support to teach it effectively? Enter high-quality professional development. This discussion, led by education experts, explores the critical shift from simply cultivating STEM learners to empowering future professionals, emphasizing the role of early, real-world exposure in shaping career readiness. When teachers feel empowered, they, in turn, empower students to become the STEM leaders of tomorrow.​​3:45 - 4:45 PM: Closing Keynote: The Future of Education​Moderator: Liz Willen, Executive Editor, The Hechinger Report​Speakers:​Randi Weingarten, President, American Federation of Teachers​Dr. Leah Austin, President & CEO, National Black Child Development Institute​Doreen Gehry Nelson, Founding Director, Design-Based Learning by the UCLA Graduate School of Education & Information Studies, Center X for the UCLA Design-Based Learning Project; Professor Emerita of California State Polytechnic University, Pomona, School of Education and Integrative Studies; Adjunct Professor in the Cal Poly College of Environmental Design; and was Professor at Art Center College of Design in Pasadena, California, from 2002-present ​​4:45 - 4:50 PM: Closing Remarks ​Marina Stenos, Managing Partner, FINN Partners​Emily Embury, Senior Partner, FINN Partners​5:00 - 6:00 PM: Humble Hang with music, cocktails & moreLocationAtelier 12051205 E Cesar Chavez St, Austin, TX 78702, USAPresented byFINN X Humble VenturesSubscribeHosted ByEmily EmburyMarina StenosContact the HostReport EventAIWellnessWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: SXSW: Service Design at the City of Austin
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byOpen Austin EventsSubscribeHosted ByOpen Austin41 GoingAsy Dhaif, Pranay Baid and 39 othersContact the HostReport EventFeatured in SXSWSXSW: Service Design at the City of AustinOpen Austin EventsResidences at The TriangleAustin, TexasRegistrationWelcome! To join the event, please register below. RegisterYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​In Austin for SXSW Edu? Work in Gov Tech? Want to network with public minded designers? Come join Open Austin's monthly Design Community of Practice and hear from Mark Janchar about the City of Austin's website redesign.​Agenda:​Mingle (5-min)​"Service Design at the City of Austin" by Mark Janchar (15-min)​Q&A (15-min)​More mingling​About our speaker:Mark Janchar (he/him) is a service designer at the City of Austin's Communications & Technology Management Department. He'll share his experience getting hired into the Service Design Lab within the Office of Design and Delivery in 2018, and working for the Innovation Office, Emergency Operations Center, and the Airport. Mark will also touch on what’s going on with the City’s website, and how his current team, Digital Strategy and Solutions, uses service design to inform that process.Notes:​All Open Austin events are photographed. If you don't want your picture taken, let us know through Eventbrite or in-person during the event.​Check event photos to see parking info.LocationResidences at The Triangle4600 W Guadalupe St, Austin, TX 78751, USAPresented byOpen Austin EventsSubscribeHosted ByOpen Austin41 GoingAsy Dhaif, Pranay Baid and 39 othersContact the HostReport EventWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: Equitech Texas Welcome Breakfast
content: Explore EventsSign InHosted ByLaurie Felker JonesContact the HostReport EventFeatured in SXSWEquitech Texas Welcome BreakfastHosted by Laurie Felker JonesRegister to See AddressAustin, TexasRegistrationApproval RequiredYour registration is subject to approval by the host.Welcome! To join the event, please register below. Request to JoinYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​Welcome!​This Equitech in ATX breakfast event to kick off the big Festival will be a place for a mix of mission-driven, under-estimated founders, funders, and allies to convene, make connections, and celebrate each other!​Join friends and colleagues from Baltimore to Austin, London to The Bay Area, Oakland to Tulsa, and many places in between as we gather to share in like-minded fellowship, our best practices, potential partnerships, and link up our pipelines across the country, and the world.​Sponsorships are available; email lfj@modern-tender.com. Space is limited to 250 guests. RSVPs are required.​About Equitech​Born in Baltimore, Equitech is a movement to build an inclusive tech city, unlocking economic potential and opportunity, and creating a culture of belonging in tech. Learn more at: upsurgebaltimore.com​About our event location​Inn Cahoots is a proud host and sponsor of this event! Inn Cahoots is a female-founded, owned and operated hotel and event space located in the heart of downtown Austin.​Street parking is available alongside Inn Cahoots, which is within easy walking distance to the heart of SXSW, the Austin Convention Center.​Big Ups to our fabulous Equitech sponsors!!!​Get to know these amazing orgs doing awesome work to support and advance founders, funders, and eco-systems with a foundation of equity.​​The AmFam Institute is a venture capital firm and partner of choice for exceptional entrepreneurs who are building scalable, sustainable businesses in a long-term effort to close equity gaps in the United States. ​Carta is an ownership and equity management platform trusted by thousands of founders, investors, and employees.​The Creative Executive champions opportunity, creativity, leadership, and partnership through executive development, cohort and team coaching for high-growth, in-transition companies. We align executives and teams to do big things that make an impact on their products, industries, stakeholders, and communities.  ​Camelback Ventures aims to create a more diverse social innovation ecosystem that leverages the genius of all people. We identify leaders with promising ideas, and empower them to enact change within their communities through our initiatives where we provide an intentional blend of coaching, capital, connections, community, and curriculum.​​divinc is on a mission to generate social and economic equity through entrepreneurship.​EcoMap Technologies is an AI-solution that enables ecosystem builders to understand, manage, and scale their entrepreneurial ecosystem. (This venture is also a Techstars Equitech alum hailing from Baltimore, MD!)​Ed Farm Launched in partnership with Apple and Alabama Power Foundation in 2020, Ed Farm empowers educators, students, and adult learners to not only thrive in today’s digital age, but prepare for the advancements of tomorrow. Through tech-focused programming, leading-edge learning environments, and innovative tools, Ed Farm is on a mission to close the growing digital skills gap in communities across the southeast and beyond. Headquartered in Birmingham, Alabama, Ed Farm is part of Propel Education alongside Propel Center.​ImpactAlpha is the leading global publication covering the trillions of dollars in capital moving into impact investing and sustainable finance. The subscription-based media platform is a trusted source of news and data for professionals and institutions around the world. ​​Inn Cahoots is a female founded four-story boutique hotel and event venue in Austin, TX.​Kapor Foundation aims to both impact the national technology landscape and build inclusive tech ecosystems in key regions. We conduct research, make strategic grants, invest in entrepreneurs and funds, and inform equitable technology policy across four focus areas necessary to enhance racial justice and equity in tech.​Lindsay Bailey Law Corporation (LBLC) focuses on Cross-border tech + entertainment law firm, with practices rooted in Vancouver + Austin, providing strategic legal counsel to a diverse clientele and being instrumental in protecting the intellectual + creative rights of artists + entrepreneurs in an ever-evolving digital world.​Modern Tender is a boutique innovation agency that partners with impact tech founders and funders to build ventures, build markets and provide capital strategies for purpose and profit.​TechBirmingham's mission is to strengthen and advocate for the technology ecosystem in Birmingham, Alabama. In doing so, they promote tech companies in the region, help recruit and retain tech talent and entrepreneurs, and provide the current and future workforce with technical education and professional development opportunities.​​UpSurge Baltimore is a non-profit ecosystem building organization building the first Equitech city in the world in Baltimore. Their mission is to mobilize Baltimore's tech ecosystem around startups by strengthening its culture and connectivity, with an intentional focus on strategies that produce outcomes for Black, women, and other underestimated founders and leaders.​Versatility is an IT and Management Consulting firm specializing in Business and Digital Transformation, enabling organizations to achieve sustainable success. By delivering innovative solutions and designing tailored products/services, Versatility accelerates modernization, fosters operational efficiency, and enhances scalability for its clients.​​Village Capital supports and invests in early-stage startups, solving problems around climate innovation and adaptation, economic mobility, and equitable access to essential services.​Wilson Isuani PLLC is a team consisting of a registered patent attorney and corporate counsel. Our female-led firm provides full-service IP and outside general counsel services to entrepreneurs and growing companies, bringing decades of experience, first-rate legal and technical training, and a relationship-first approach to each client interaction.​Wilson Sonsini Since the firm's inception in the early days of Silicon Valley, Wilson Sonsini has been privileged to help lay the groundwork for some of the world's most innovative technology, life sciences, and growth companies. As the nation's leading law firm representing venture-backed companies, we have counseled thousands of entrepreneurs starting new businesses, advising on the formation of companies, equity structures, negotiations with investors, intellectual property rights, and other issues vital to their success.LocationPlease register to see the exact location of this event.Austin, TexasHosted ByLaurie Felker JonesContact the HostReport EventWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: FINN Partners x humble ventures: Future of Health Day Brought to you by Doceree
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byFINN X Humble VenturesSubscribeHosted ByRItesh PatelAjit VergheseServiceNow VenturesCelia JonesContact the HostReport EventAIWellnessFeatured in SXSWFINN Partners x humble ventures: Future of Health Day Brought to you by DocereeFINN X Humble VenturesAtelier 1205Austin, TexasRegistrationWelcome! To join the event, please register below. Registration closes at  RegisterYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​A Day of Healthcare Innovation in partnership with Doceree​This event is open to anyone 09.25 – 09.30 AM: Welcome || Opening Remarks - Ritesh Patel & Ajit Verghese, Founder, Humble Ventures​09.30 – 10.15 AM: Off Planet Healthcare: Shaping the Future of Space MedicineSpeaker:  Savi Glowe, Co-Founder & CEO, BioAstraA discussion to explore the fascinating intersection of space biology and the emerging technologies of space medicine. We will discuss some of the most cutting-edge discoveries at the core of biology and focus on how insights from Earth-based healthcare can inform and revolutionise medical practices beyond our planet.​10.15 - 10.45 AM: Future of Food x Health Enabled by Cloud TechnologySpeaker: Heather Nelson, Managing Director, DeloitteA discussion on how cloud technology can address food security to advance health. A Deloitte landscape analysis explored how cloud technology can optimize the food value chain, and help ensure access to nutritious food for all. By harnessing data-driven insights and integrating advanced technologies such as Internet of Things (IoT), artificial intelligence (AI), and predictive analytics, stakeholders from various sectors—including technology providers, agricultural organizations, food distributors, and non-profits—can boost operational efficiencies, reduce waste, and improve food distribution systems. Learn how innovative, cloud-enabled strategies are making commercial food value chains more sustainable and accessible for community well-being and health.10.45  – 11.30 AM: Bioengineering Approaches to Solve the US Organ Shortage: Carnegie Mellon University College of Engineering Moderator: Ritesh Patel, Chief Growth Officer, DocereeSpeakers:Keith Cook, David Edward Schramm Professor and Head, Biomedical Engineering (CMU)Rosalyn Abbott, Associate Professor, Biomedical Engineering (CMU)Adam Feinberg, Professor, Biomedical Engineering and Materials Science & Engineering (CMU)C. Burcin Taner, M.D., Chair of the Transplant Center at the Mayo Clinic (Florida)Organ transplantation is one of the greatest innovations of modern medicine. Unfortunately, there is an immense shortage in the number of organs available for transplantation, leading to long wait times, deaths on the waiting list, and patients who are never even considered for a transplant. Developing biomedical technologies have an opportunity to limit or, potentially, eliminate this shortage. This session will highlight an ongoing partnership between Carnegie Mellon University and Mayo Clinic and their research to repair dysfunctional organs or fabricate new organs from scratch. This research includes ex-vivo organ repair, in which an organ is perfused for days to weeks outside the body and treated to repair damage, and 3D bioprinting, in which living tissue can be printed to replicate the structure and function of native organs.​11.30 AM –12.15 PM: Spurring Innovation: The Power of Local Ecosystems & Public-Private PartnershipsModerator: Patric Rayburn, Head of Engagement, Catalyst by Wellstar Speakers:  Allyson Eman, CEO, Venture Atlanta  Gareth Evans, Founder of VECKTA Claire Ross, Founder & CEO, MixEatUp  While change has always been the constant in innovation, the pace of change has reached fever-pitch.  In this engaging panel, founders, investors and innovation ecosystem leaders will discuss how local ecosystems are collaborating to maintain the momentum of innovation in healthcare and beyond.      ​This panel will explore how local innovation ecosystems and public-private partnerships are playing a crucial role in fueling venture activity, driving breakthrough solutions, and sustaining progress despite unpredictable challenges.    12.15 – 1.00 PM: Lunch Break and get to know people​1.00 - 1.30 PM: Delivering the Future of PharmacySpeaker: Amit Gir, CEO & Board-Certified Physician, Phox Health​1.30- 2.15 PM: AI and The Future of Pharma MarketingModerator: Kamya Elawadhi, Chief Client Officer, DocereeSpeakers:Cozi Namer - VP of Consumer and Clinician Innovation, PfizerJason Gee, Senior VP, Client Experience at Havas MediaJeff McDonald, CEO & Co-Founder at Kythera Labs2.15 – 2.45 PM: AI at the Crossroads: Navigating Innovation Amid U.S. Policy and DeregulationModerator: Ganesh Padmanabhan, CEO of Autonomize AISpeakers:Dr. Nasim Afsar, former Chief Health Officer of Oracle HealthDr. Pritesh Gandhi, former Chief Medical Officer of Dept of Homeland SecurityThe U.S. government's strategic initiatives, including the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) led by Elon Musk, aim to harness AI to streamline federal operations and reduce systemic waste. Concurrently, there's a push towards deregulating AI to accelerate innovation, potentially reshaping industries and enhancing consumer empowerment.Our panel will delve into how these policies might redefine the AI landscape, balancing rapid technological advancement with ethical considerations and the public interest.2.45 - 3.30 PM: Decentralising Public HealthModerator: Leslie Kirk, CEO, Innsena Speakers: Brandon Talley, PhD- Chief of Programs and Innovation, CDC FoundationJ.T. Lane - SVP population health and innovation, Association of State and Territorial Health OfficialsKat McDavitt - CEO, Zorya Foundation Dr. Matt Christiansen, MPH - Vice Chair, Board of Directors, West Virginia First Foundation and Chief Medical Officer, Valley Health System, Inc.3.30 - 4.00 PM: Building an Open Innovation Ecosystem Across Institutions: How Howard University, WPI, and humble are Transforming Technology CommercializationModerator: Ajit Verghese - General Partner, humble; Co-Founder Smartest StudioSpeakers: Terry Adams - Director, Office of Technology Innovation and Entrepreneurship at Worcester Polytechnic InstituteAdia Coleman - Intellectual Property Manager of the Technology Transfer Department in the Office of Research at Howard UniversityTim Darcy - Partner, humble; Co-Founder Smartest Studio4.00 - 4.30 PM: An overview of The Pearl: Charlotte’s Innovation DistrictSpeakers: Santosh Mohan - Vice President, Innovation and New Ventures at Advocate HealthDeveloped in partnership between Atrium Health and Wexford Science & Technology, The Pearl leverages the partners’ experience and forward-thinking approach to embrace new ideas, research and technologies that will advance healthcare solutions and welcome people from all walks of life within our community4.30 - 5.00 PM: Harnessing Real World Patient DataA fireside conversation: Speakers:Reginald Swift, Founder & CEO - Rubix LSShuchi Rana, Global Head of Whitespace Intelligence, ServiceNow 5.00 - 5.45 PM: Nex-Gen Care: Partnering Today for Patient-Focused TomorrowsA fireside conversation:Speakers: Grace (Polanski) Cordovano, PhD, BCPA, Co-Founder, Unblock Health, and Jen Horonjeff, Founder, CEO, Savvy Cooperative Authentic patient-centricity involves designing healthcare systems and solutions prioritizing patients' needs, preferences, and values. It's not a nice-to-have, it's a solid business strategy. Understanding patients' experiences leads to more compassionate and effective care. Providing patients with tools and information to take charge of their health, drives agency, autonomy, and partnership in their care.​Join us for this fireside chat as we talk patient and care partner perspectives, the importance of patient voices in shaping research, policy-making, and healthcare conversations, and our collective responsibility to create an innovative and hopeful ecosystem.​Don't miss a top-secret VIP performance by a rising star to close out the day!5.45 - 6.00 PM: Closing remarks6:00 pm – 7.30 PM: "humble hang" - music, cocktails & more.LocationAtelier 12051205 E Cesar Chavez St, Austin, TX 78702, USAPresented byFINN X Humble VenturesSubscribeHosted ByRItesh PatelAjit VergheseServiceNow VenturesCelia JonesContact the HostReport EventAIWellnessWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

RegisterYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​----UPDATE: LOCATION WILL BE 400 Josephine St, Austin, TX 78704Carpenters Hall----​Hi Everyone, ​Exited founders are the most likely group to establish the next unicorns, cash cows, venture capital firms, or any other ventures. Every day, we tackle a myriad of complex problems that demand our persistent effort. The best inspirations and solutions to these significant challenges often come from other experienced founders themselves.​PEF Austin is home to an unparalleled assembly of founders in Austin. After our successful yearly big meetup and thoughtful discussions with many of you, we've decided to keep the ball 🎱 rolling with bi-weekly meetups! ​Join us for a great breakfast and vibrant conversations with fellow founders. It’s the perfect opportunity to network, share insights, and start your day with positive energy! Let's make these gatherings a cornerstone of our community. Looking forward to seeing everyone there!Location400 Josephine StAustin, TX 78704, USAPresented byPEF AustinSubscribeHosted BySahin Boydas21 GoingShari Wynne Ressler, Nisarg and 19 othersContact the HostReport EventWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

Immerse yourself in a dynamic showcase of Argentina’s cutting-edge technology and creative industries. This is your chance to mingle with leading experts and fellow enthusiasts, all while enjoying the unique blend of culture and tech that only Argentina can offer.​Whether you're a tech enthusiast, a culture buff, or simply looking for some inspiration, La Casa Argentina is the place to be. With interactive displays, insightful talks, and plenty of opportunities to connect, this event promises to be a highlight of your adventure. name: Startup Casa 2025
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byInicio VenturesSubscribeHosted ByJorge M. CalderonJake LefkerElviaMonica MartensContact the HostReport EventAIFeatured in SXSWStartup Casa 2025Inicio VenturesRegister to See AddressAustin, TexasRegistrationApproval RequiredYour registration is subject to approval by the host.Welcome! To join the event, please register below. Request to JoinYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​Join us at Startup Casa, the second annual gathering in Austin—adjacent to SXSW—dedicated to recognizing and showcasing the dynamic Latino startup ecosystem.​Hosted by Inicio, in partnership with Google for Startups, and additional support from J.P. Morgan, Living Cities and Cotto Wealth Management Group at Morgan Stanley, this special day-long event offers a collaborative and festive space for meaningful connections and thought-provoking content. We invite Funders, Founders, Field Builders & Friends to spend the full day with like-minded innovators.​Set in an outdoor venue in downtown Austin, this celebration features:​An all-day pop-up Coffee Bar by Progeny​An AI founder/investor/expert speed-dating session​A Latina luncheon with a live podcast​Three outstanding expert panels​A CPG startup expo in a Mercado-like setting with games and activities​The Inicio Icon Award ceremony​An all-out "fiesta" with live music and a DJ to close the night​Complimentary food & beverages will be available during portions of the day, with additional options for purchase.​Join us to celebrate its impact, build connections, and help bridge the Latino and broader startup ecosystems for the benefit of all.​Updated Agenda​Casa Café Kick-off (10:00 AM – 12:30 PM)​Location: Casa Café (Center of Venue)​10:00 AM – 4:00 PM | Casa Café by Progeny Coffee​Experience the rich flavors of Progeny Coffee in a welcoming setting. Schedule meetings, connect with fellow innovators, or co-work in our pop-up coffee shop.​10:00 AM – 11:00 PM | La Taquicardia Food Truck Available All Day​Savor Latino-inspired dishes from an onsite taco truck.​11:00 AM – 11:00 PM | Cantina/Bars Available​Multiple bars will be open throughout the Austin Garden venue.​11:15 AM – 12:30 PM | AI Investor/Expert/Founder Mentor Speed Dating at Casa Café​Welcome:   Danny Navarro (Google for Startups)​Engage in one-on-one speed networking between founders, investors, and AI experts. Pitch ideas, explore collaborations, and discover new opportunities.​El Jardín (12:00 PM – 2:00 PM)​Location: Stage 2 & Tables (Right Side of Venue)​12:00 PM – 1:45 PM | Celebrating Latinas in the Startup Ecosystem​Welcome:   Monica Martens (Inicio) & Elvia Perez (Inicio)​Podcaster:   Lyanne Alfaro (Moneda Moves).  Guests:  Maria Jose Palacio (Progeny Coffee), Eneida Roman (Amplify Latinx), Jessica Salinas (New Media Ventures)​A live recording of Moneda Moves, featuring discussions on Latina entrepreneurship and business.​La Sala (2:00 PM – 4:15 PM)​Location: Main Stage (Near Entrance)​2:00 PM – 2:45 PM | Panel #1: Startup Innovation & Policy​Moderator:   Lili Gangas (Kapor Foundation), Panelists:  Miguel Algarin (Living Cities), Jesús Salas (Slauson & Co.),  Maryam Janani-Flores (MJF Strategies, Former Chief of Staff-EDA)​Explore the role local and federal governments play in accelerating Latino startup growth.​3:30 PM – 4:15 PM | Panel #2: Latino Startup Ecosystem Success & Learnings​Moderator:   Jennifer Garcia (LBAN), Panelists:  Adrian J DeLeon (Innovare), Andres Morin (VamosVentures), Diego Barajas (Morgan Stanley)​A discussion on successes, challenges, and future opportunities for regions scaling their Latino Startup Ecosystem.​Startup Mercado (4:15 PM – 7:00 PM)​Location: Across Venue​4:30 PM – 6:30 PM | CPG Startup Expo​Experience happy hour at a showcase of innovative CPG startups with product demonstrations and giveaways.​4:15 PM – 7:00 PM | Interactive Plaza Activities​Paletas & Fruteria Treats​360 Picture Experience with Low-Rider Motorcycles​Temporary Tattoo Station​Lawn Games​Crafts​…and more!​Fiesta en la Plaza (7:00 PM – 11:00 PM)​Location: Main Stage & Across Venue​7:00 PM – 8:30 PM | ICON Awards – Inicio ICON Award Keynote & Ceremony​MC:   George Ploss (Oracle NetSuite Startup Accelerator)​Welcome:  Danny Navarro (Google for Startups), Jorge Calderon (Inicio)​Keynote:  Julian Castro (CEO LCF & Former US Secretary of Housing and Urban Development)​Icons:  Isabel Casillas Guzman (Former US SBA Administrator), Maxeme Tuchman (Co-Founder/CEO, Caribu-Sold to Mattel), Eduardo “Eddie” Medina (Co-Founder/COO, BetterUp)​Recognizing visionary Latino startup leaders who are shaping the future of innovation. Hear their stories of perseverance, impact, and the transformative power of entrepreneurship.​8:30 PM – 11:00 PM | La Fiesta - Salsa Lesson & Rumba​Celebrate, dance, and continue connecting as a live Latin band and DJ bring the night to life.LocationPlease register to see the exact location of this event.Austin, TexasPresented byInicio VenturesSubscribeHosted ByJorge M. name: SaaS Founders Mixer with Silverton Partners and Forum Ventures (Sponsored by Deel, Carta, and Zendesk)
content: Explore EventsSign InHosted ByAndrew ChoKenan KitchenMaria PopeAddie RascheNia PryceZendesk for Startups192 GoingKelsey Kearns, Will Bright and 190 othersContact the HostReport EventFeatured in SXSWSaaS Founders Mixer with Silverton Partners and Forum Ventures (Sponsored by Deel, Carta, and Zendesk)Hosted by Andrew Cho & 5 othersRegister to See AddressAustin, TexasRegistrationApproval RequiredYour registration is subject to approval by the host.Welcome! To join the event, please register below. Request to JoinYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​Come join the SaaS Founders Mixer in Austin, Texas!​If you're a funded founder in town for SXSW, this is your ultimate networking opportunity. Connect with a curated group of innovative founders, investors, and industry leaders in a relaxed setting over drinks and light bites.​Why Attend?​Meet and mingle with like-minded entrepreneurs shaping the future of SaaS.​Build meaningful relationships that could lead to your next big partnership or breakthrough.​Enjoy a fun, vibrant atmosphere at an exclusive members-only Austin club, open for this event!​About the hosts:​​​​​​Deel makes hiring contractors and employees seamless across 150+ countries. They handle payroll, taxes, compliance, immigration, and more so that you can focus more time on building. Today, Deel serves over 25,000 customers from early stage startups to enterprises like Nike, Dropbox, Shopify, and Notion.​Forum Ventures is the leading early-stage fund, accelerator and AI venture studio for B2B SaaS startups. Founded in 2014, we’re on a mission to make the B2B SaaS journey easier, more accessible and successful for early-stage founders. From our Studio to Accelerator to Pre-Seed programming, we have the resources and network to help founders navigate the early stages of their founder journey. Forum is investing in 85+ SaaS companies this year. Pitch us here.​Silverton Partners is focused on funding and mentoring early-stage businesses led by founders who share in its commitment to disrupt growth markets and build enduring companies. Founded in 2006, the firm brings the benefits of its vast network and decades of rich experience to each partnership. Austin-based Silverton is the most active venture capital investor in Texas and has been the initial investor behind visionary companies including WP Engine, Storable, SailPoint, Silicon Labs, TurnKey Vacation Rentals, The Zebra, AlertMedia, Aceable, Self Financial, Wheel, and Billie. For more information, visit www.silvertonpartners.com.​Carta, the industry leader in equity management and valuation software, brings unparalleled expertise and innovation to the table. Designed for founders and investors like you, Carta leads the way in equity management, streamlining processes like cap table management and equity issuance.​Zendesk for Startups empowers startups with the best customer support platform that leverages AI capabilities to accelerate growth. Zendesk knows that startups move quickly, so we've designed an easy-to-use product that scales and provides you with critical metrics in the early days of your company's journey. Apply now to enjoy six free months of Zendesk.LocationPlease register to see the exact location of this event.Austin, TexasHosted ByAndrew ChoKenan KitchenMaria PopeAddie RascheNia PryceZendesk for Startups192 GoingKelsey Kearns, Will Bright and 190 othersContact the HostReport EventWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: ✨ ayana x Cherub 2025 Founders Panel 🚀
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byayana FoundationSubscribeayana, a 501(c)(3) foundation, uplifts women founders worldwide through education, community, and enhanced access to funding.Hosted ByayanaElisaMyneco RamirezKristina KlaasKatia ZaitsevJaclyn JohnsonCherubAngie NeasContact the HostReport EventAIFeatured in SXSW✨ ayana x Cherub 2025 Founders Panel 🚀ayana Foundation1114 E Cesar Chavez StAustin, TexasRegistrationEvent FullIf you’d like, you can join the waitlist.Please click on the button below to join the waitlist. You will be notified if additional spots become available.Join WaitlistYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​Join the ayana Foundation & Cherub for an exciting kickoff for week of energized networking and connections! 🚀​📅 Date: Friday, March 7th | 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm📍 Location: Own HQ (1114 E Cesar Chávez St Austin, TX 78701)🤝 In Partnership With: ayana, Beebizy, Cherub, Chloe Capital, Justworks & Own🌟 About: Mark your calendars - the ayana Foundation and own. is thrilled to host a dynamic event celebrating the vibrant community of entrepreneurs in Austin! Whether you're a seasoned founder, an emerging entrepreneur, or an investor, this event is designed to spark meaningful connections and provide valuable insights.​What You Can Look Forward To💬 Expert Founder Panel | 4:00 pm - 5:00 pm"From Startup to Sell: Real Talk on Exits & Acquisitions": A must-hear with founders discussing exit strategies, personal entrepreneurial journeys and sharing actionable steps to prepare for an exit or acquisition.​​Panelists:​​Kendra Scott - Founder & CCO | Kendra Scott​Kendra Scott is a billion-dollar namesake brand, known for its innovative jewelry, vibrant designs, and commitment to philanthropy. What started in 2002 with just $500 and a tea box of jewelry has grown into a global lifestyle brand with over 150 stores and 3,200 employees. Dedicated to empowering women and youth, Kendra has donated over $70 million to causes through her company and the Kendra Scott Foundation, and founded the Kendra Scott Women’s Entrepreneurial Leadership Institute (KS WELI) at UT Austin. A recurring Shark on ABC’s Shark Tank and a board member of the Breast Cancer Research Foundation, Kendra continues to lead with her philosophy of Family, Fashion, and Philanthropy from Austin, Texas.​Miki Agrawal - Founder, Chief Creative Officer | TUSHY​Miki Agrawal is a trailblazing entrepreneur, speaker, and two-time bestselling author renowned for founding disruptive companies like TUSHY and THINX. A "Young Global Leader" recognized by the World Economic Forum and named one of Fast Company's "Most Creative People," Miki infuses her talks with two decades of boundary-pushing business experience, captivating audiences with her insights into innovative marketing, product development, and business scaling. With a track record of building two nine-figure companies that disrupted two industries, Miki is now channeling her entrepreneurial spirit into her third venture, Hiro Technologies, aiming to solve the global plastic crisis with nature-inspired plastic eating mushrooms.​Adriana Carrig - Founder & CEO | Little Words Project​Little Words Project is a jewelry brand dedicated to spreading kindness and self-love through affirmation bracelets. Inspired by her own experiences with bullying, Adrianna launched the company in 2013, growing it into a multi-million-dollar brand with national retail partners like Target and Nordstrom, and a fan base that includes Selena Gomez, Alicia Keys, and Taylor Swift. Committed to philanthropy, her Little Words Big Impact initiative has raised over $1 million for meaningful causes, and she founded Herself Co., a nonprofit empowering young women through confidence education. Named Entrepreneur of the Year by Ernst & Young, Carrig has been featured in Forbes, TODAY, and Inc., and in Fall 2024, she published her first book, The Power of Little Words.​Kelly Ann Winget - Founder & CEO | Alternative Wealth Partners​Kelly Ann Winget is a visionary leader in alternative investments and the driving force behind Alternative Wealth Partners (AWP). She has raised nearly $1 billion in private capital, driven by a mission to bring institutional-grade investments to a diverse base of investors. At AWP, she leads a team specializing in non-correlated assets like oil and gas, private equity, and venture investing, all aimed at serving “everyday millionaires.” Committed to financial inclusivity, she advocates for investors who seek sophisticated options beyond traditional avenues. Kelly Ann shares her insights through LinkedIn, her book Pitch the Btch, and keynote appearances at events like Alts Expo and Women’s Venture Summit. Her insights have been featured in prominent media like Forbes, Fast Company, Inc. and NASDAQ. Through AWP, she continues to redefine wealth as a means of empowerment, paving the way for impactful investments across diverse communities.​Moderator: Jaclyn Johnson - Co-Founder | Cherub; Founder & Chief Creative Officer | Create & Cultivate​Jaclyn Johnson is a serial entrepreneur with an impressive track record, she sold her first business by the age of 28 and went on to build and sell her second multimillion-dollar company, Create & Cultivate, before turning 35. Recognizing a gap in resources, events, and community for female entrepreneurs, she launched Create & Cultivate as a first-of-its-kind platform that connects brands of all sizes to uplift and empower women in business. Through her work, Jaclyn has built and scaled businesses that make a lasting impact, cementing her status as one of the most well-known and respected female entrepreneurs today. Named a Forbes 30 Under 30 and Adweek Disruptor, Jaclyn has been featured in Fast Company, LA Times, Entrepreneur, and more. She is a thought leader for millennial and Gen Z women navigating their careers, offering insights on everything from starting a business to breaking barriers in leadership. Her passion for supporting underrepresented founders led her to launch Cherub, a marketplace connecting entrepreneurs with investors. ​🍸 Founder & Funder Happy Hour Mixer | 5:00 pm - 7:00 pmSponsored by Bowery Legal & Chloe CapitalProvided by Bloom Nutrition, Brae, Chareau, GutPersonal, Jeng, Kif Kefir Water, Mixim, Mom Juice Wine, Not a Celebrity Tequila, Rejuvenation, RingaA casual, fun space where founders and funders can connect and spark new opportunities ✨🎁 Cherub Angel ATMPowered by PerchMeet the 30+ brands ParticipatingFilled with products from Cherub brands who are actively fundraising. Low on deal flow? The first 100 angel investors who show their Cherub profiles at the Cherub Angel ATM will get a token to test before you invest. 💎 Kendra Scott | Merch Pop-Up20% of proceeds will go to the ayana FoundationAn exclusive shopping experience featuring iconic jewelry and accessories. ​📿 Little Words Project | Charm Bar Pop-UpAn interactive Charm Bar where guests are invited to adorn their bracelets with personalized charms that reflect their unique stories and personal affirmations. ​💉IVitamin | Wellness Boost Pop-UpComplimentary B12 shots with an discounted IV drip purchase to keep you feeling refreshed & recharged!**First come, first serve : reserve your spot in advance [Link Coming Soon]**​🎸 Live, Local Music from Anne B. Johnston | 5:00 PMJoin Anne B. Johnston, founder of Created and a Forbes Top Next-Gen Wealth Advisor, as she redefines finance - making it clear, approachable, and even beautiful. Through Fin Rock™, Anne blends financial education with rock and roll to empower people to take command of their financial lives.​🌮 Delicious Light BitesSponsored by Farmers Fridge & Partake Foods​📸 High Quality Content CaptureBy Ben Porter Photography👯 Why Attend?This is more than just an event—it's a celebration of community, innovation, and collaboration. Whether you're looking to learn from the best, connect with potential partners, or simply celebrate the incredible Austin entrepreneurial landscape. ​--------By registering for this event you consent to:-Being photographed, filmed, and/or recorded for promotional purposes by the event organizers for use in event-related materials, including but not limited to: social media, websites, and promotional materials.-Being notified about this event and future communications from ayana and Cherub - you may unsubscribe at any time.Location1114 E Cesar Chavez StAustin, TX 78702, USAown. HQPresented byayana FoundationSubscribeayana, a 501(c)(3) foundation, uplifts women founders worldwide through education, community, and enhanced access to funding.Hosted ByayanaElisaMyneco RamirezKristina KlaasKatia ZaitsevJaclyn JohnsonCherubAngie NeasContact the HostReport EventAIWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

You will be notified if additional spots become available.Join WaitlistYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​Join Columbia Alumni Association’s Global Health & Wellness Network and Health Tech Nerds for an exclusive HealthTech Networking Happy Hour at Moonshine Grill in downtown Austin! 🎉​🤝 Connect with investors, founders, clinicians, data scientists, and other healthtech professionals for an evening of meaningful conversations, collaboration, and innovation. Whether you're looking to expand your network, explore new opportunities, or simply unwind with like-minded professionals, this is the perfect setting to do so!​Enjoy a vibrant atmosphere, engaging discussions, and a chance to build connections that matter. Don’t miss this fantastic opportunity to meet fellow industry leaders in the heart of Austin during SXSW! 🌟​Must be 21+ to attend. ✅​​Columbia Alumni Association’s Global Health and Wellness Network (GHWN) is Columbia University’s premier community dedicated to health and wellness. With chapters across six major cities in New York, NorCal, SoCal, Seattle, Austin, and Boston, GHWN's mission is to connect and empower Columbia alumni who are passionate about health and wellness by hosting programs that inspire innovation in these fields. GHWN has three pillars: healthcare venture (business), knowledge-sharing (educational), and relationship-building (social).​More about HTN Their weekly newsletter and private Slack community are high-value resources that thousands rely on to stay informed and connected in healthcare/health tech. Learn more, subscribe, and join today.LocationMoonshine Grill303 Red River St, Austin, TX 78701, USADowntown, next to Austin Convention CenterHosted ByColumbia Alumni Association Global Health & Wellness85 GoingAlex Daamen, Abhinav Paturi and 83 othersContact the HostReport EventWellnessWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

Reverse VC was born outta Stanford GSB at Bishop Auditorium- Our #nonEmployeeCoFounder VC’s included Luke Nosek, Jon Teo and Honorable Ken Howery (he’s right now ambassador to Denmark). #nonEmployeeCoFounder is also the AI agent that acts like a decentralized App to inflate your equity by installing a 0% dilution cofounder. name: Founder TechWalk SXSW Edition | Austin 3/8 | Sponsored by Rho
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byTechWalkSubscribeWe're building a different sort of networking event for members of the Tech and SaaS communities to get outside, meet new people, and enjoy some fresh air, while practicing mindful movement.Hosted ByCaroline GomesChristine Farrier Rosemin54 GoingLida, Will Bright and 52 othersContact the HostReport EventFitnessWellnessFeatured in SXSWFounder TechWalk SXSW Edition | Austin 3/8 | Sponsored by RhoTechWalkAustinAustin, TexasRegistrationWelcome! To join the event, please register below. Registration closes at  RegisterYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​​You're invited to attend the FOUNDER Walk: SXSW EDITION TechWalk sponsored by Rho - a special edition "walk and talk" event.Meet our Co-Hosts:​Alex Daamen - Founder, MindTrek​​​​Stephanie Guapana - Founder, Ruoom Inc.​John Dolan - Founder, Double Down Group​Bethany Stachenfeld - Co-Founder, Sendspark​Ashish Ghimire - Co-Founder & COO, echowin​Adebayo Ajibade - Founder, Loubby AI​Michael Ly - GP A/F Fund, CEO, Reconciled​Christine Farrier Rosemin - Founder, TechWalk​Hosted by TechWalk, a networking community for Tech and SaaS professionals, this walk will offer members of the tech ecosystem the opportunity to gather together for a casual stroll and impactful conversations.​​​​We're building a different sort of networking event for members of the Tech and SaaS communities to get outside, meet new people, and enjoy some fresh air while helping to restore a healthy balance to the day. Expect to meet founders, investors, operators, and industry experts immersed in the Tech, SaaS and Startup ecosystem, who value unique moments for meaningful IRL connections.​​​​How does it work? Grab some comfortable foot gear, weather-appropriate clothes, and your beverage of choice as you join fellow walk participants for a one-hour loop in the park. Your walk guides will help facilitate walking partner swaps and offer conversation starters, but we can almost guarantee a very "natural" flow of discussion. See what we did there? :)​​​​This is a chance to network, share ideas, and build relationships in a healthy and refreshing addition to a busy schedule of panels, roundtables, and happy hours. Your body and your brain will thank you!​​Welcome to the TechWalk community. Every journey begins with a first step, and we’re genuinely delighted to get acquainted. By registering for TechWalk events, you consent to the use of your name, likeness, any photographs taken during the event, and any details provided for our event information, marketing, and promotional purposes, by TechWalk and our partners. We’re thrilled to have you with us.LocationAustinTX, USAPresented byTechWalkSubscribeWe're building a different sort of networking event for members of the Tech and SaaS communities to get outside, meet new people, and enjoy some fresh air, while practicing mindful movement.Hosted ByCaroline GomesChristine Farrier Rosemin54 GoingLida, Will Bright and 52 othersContact the HostReport EventFitnessWellnessWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: Hiring for Startups in the Era of Generative AI
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byA-PlayersSubscribeWe help mission-driven people and startups make a positive changeHosted ByA-PlayersLesya ArnoldLyubava ObodenkoContact the HostReport EventAIFeatured in SXSWHiring for Startups in the Era of Generative AIA-PlayersRegister to See AddressAustin, TexasRegistrationApproval RequiredYour registration is subject to approval by the host.Welcome! To join the event, please register below. Request to JoinYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​Join us for an exclusive breakfast gathering on March 8th, 9–11 AM, where top founders and investors will uncover the hiring strategies that drive funding and explosive growth in the AI era.​​What Investors Look for Before They Invest:​​Hiring Skills: The must-have abilities investors expect.​​Team-Building & Scaling Ability: How VCs assess a founder’s leadership.​​Proven Hiring Track Record: The experience that signals success.​​Red Flags & Costly Mistakes: What turns investors away.​​Delegation & Leadership: How well founders hand off key responsibilities.​​How Top Founders Recruit 10Xers and Scale Fast:​​Identifying A-Players: Proven methods to spot top talent before competitors.​​Hiring Superpowers in the AI Era: Key traits that drive rapid growth.​​Smart Team Structuring: How budgets and roles impact scaling.​​Building for Scale: The right mix of operators, visionaries, and specialists.​​Two perspectives, one table—packed with hiring insights from both those writing the checks and those building billion-dollar companies.​​Hosted by Lesya Arnold – Founder of A-Players and creator of a community for impact-driven tech startup founders and investors. Lesya and her team have built high-performing teams for 50+ startups, and she knows exactly what VCs look for in 10X founders and hires through A-Players' partnerships with top venture capital firms.​​Let’s crack the hiring code together!​* The exact location will be disclosed only to the approved guests.** The cost of the breakfast is not covered by the event organizers.LocationPlease register to see the exact location of this event.Austin, TexasPresented byA-PlayersSubscribeWe help mission-driven people and startups make a positive changeHosted ByA-PlayersLesya ArnoldLyubava ObodenkoContact the HostReport EventAIWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: Q-Branch: Global Security and Innovation Exchange (GSIX)
content: Explore EventsSign InHosted ByMasey WilliamsMarcos CervantesSam BrownJoshContact the HostReport EventFeatured in SXSWQ-Branch: Global Security and Innovation Exchange (GSIX)Hosted by Masey Williams & 3 othersQ-Branch Global Collaboration CenterAustin, TexasRegistrationApproval RequiredYour registration is subject to approval by the host.Welcome! To join the event, please register below. Request to JoinYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​The Texas Embassy presents on Saturday, March 8th; during Austin's premier event of the year...​Global Security and Innovation Exchange (GSIX) is a high-impact forum designed to advance allied collaboration at the intersection of security and innovation. Hosted by Q-Branch, GSIX convenes key stakeholders from government, military, industry, and investment to tackle the challenges and opportunities shaping the future of defense and dual-use technology.​Full Run-of-Show: ​Doors Open: 9 am​10:00 - 11:00 AM | Allies in Innovation: Case Studies for Building an International Defense Tech Business​Description: This session examines real-world case studies from government, industry, and investors, exploring the barriers and breakthroughs in allied defense innovation. Topics include regulatory challenges like ITAR, political roadblocks, and intellectual property concerns. Attendees will gain insights into successful cross-border partnerships, technology transfer models, and strategies to overcome bureaucratic hurdles.Moderator: Sean SingletonPanelists:​P1: WhiteSpace CEO​P2: Ametrine CEO​Anduril VPAffiliated Organizations: WhiteSpace, Ametrine, Anduril​11:00 AM - 1:00 PM | Break​1:00 - 2:00 PM | Allies in Innovation: Streamlining International Partnerships for Competitive Advantage (Recorded)​Description: A candid discussion among international systems integrators, government procurement officials, and investors on the complexities of allied defense collaboration. Panelists will dissect challenges such as bureaucratic inefficiencies, misaligned incentives, and regulatory constraints, while proposing strategies to create a more agile and responsive innovation framework.Moderator: Sean SingletonPanelists:​Matt MacGregor, Senior Director for Strategic Growth - Anduril Defense Industries​P1: SAIC Ventures​P2: BUCKY​P3: Marque Ventures​P4: RTX Ventures​2:30 - 3:30 PM | Navigating Allied Defense Markets: A Playbook for Companies & Investors​Description: This session provides an in-depth guide for companies and investors looking to expand into allied defense markets. It will cover market entry strategies, procurement processes, and best practices for collaboration with foreign governments and military organizations. Key speakers will highlight emerging opportunities in dual-use technology and strategies to secure funding and contracts.Moderator: Sean SingletonPanelists:​P1: Dr. Casey Perley​P2: Ross Guieb​P3: Marc Cervantes, Q-BranchAffiliated Organizations: Dr. Casey Perley, Ross Guieb, Marc Cervantes (Q-Branch)​4:00 - 5:00 PM | The State of Dual-Use Innovation​Description: A discussion on the growing need for domesticating allied supply chains in defense and security. Panelists will address supply chain vulnerabilities, the role of emerging technologies in reshoring production, and how allied nations can enhance resilience against geopolitical risks.Moderator: Marc CervantesPanelists:​P1: VETCHIP​P2: GREENROOM R​P3: HYPERFIREAffiliated Program: Australia GIA Program​8:00 PM - UTC | Allies in Innovation Collider (After Party)​Description: A high-level networking event bringing together decision-makers, policymakers, military leaders, and investors to turn discussions into action. This event aims to solidify new partnerships, foster collaboration, and drive strategic initiatives that advance global security and dual-use innovation.Notes: The Allies in Innovation Collider brings together the high-level defense innovation people who can imagine, and decide on, the initiatives, investments, and policies that will move allied efforts forward. Policymakers, military S&T and acquisition executives, industry leaders, and investors will turn the day’s discussions of allied innovation challenges and opportunities into the ideas and relationships that lead to action.​schedule subject to change​Register today for The Texas Embassy for our Dual-use focused GSIX event!LocationQ-Branch Global Collaboration Center200 E 6th St #310, Austin, TX 78701, USAHosted ByMasey WilliamsMarcos CervantesSam BrownJoshContact the HostReport EventWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

Request to JoinYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​The Health Hustlers​Join us for an evening of meaningful connection and collaboration exclusively for health, healthcare, fitness, and wellness business owners at SXSW!​Who Should Attend:​Owners & Founders: You own a health-related business or have high ambitions to build a successful health-related business.​Growth-Oriented: You're looking to connect with peers, share insights, and explore new opportunities.​Collaborative: You believe in the power of community and are eager to contribute your expertise.​Who Should NOT attend:​People who are not involved in a health-related business.​Individuals who are primarily seeking sales opportunities or leads.​What to Expect:​A relaxed and welcoming atmosphere to foster genuine connections.​Thought-provoking discussions on relevant industry topics.​Opportunities to build partnerships and collaborations.​Itinerary:​10am - 10:10pm: Meet & greet 🤝​10:10am - 10:40pm: Small group icebreakers 🧊​10:40am - 11am Speed networking 🏃‍♂️​11am: Group photo 📸​11am: Goodbyes! 👋​Please Note: This event is not a pitchfest. content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byTHRIVESubscribeHosted ByMonica TalanRamona Ortega, Esq.Mercedes Ortega-KennedyIzzy Tuccio 865 GoingKelsey Kearns, Pranay Baid and 863 othersContact the HostReport EventAICryptoFeatured in SXSWEspacio Latino 2025THRIVEQ-Branch Global Collaboration CenterAustin, TexasRegistrationWelcome! To join the event, please register below. RegisterYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​The Espacio Latino Innovation Hub 2025 at ATX ​Espacio Latino, now in its third year, has grown into the largest Latino side gathering during SXSW.​Designed to amplify representation for Latino builders and entrepreneurs, it has evolved into a central hub for driving innovation, fostering collaboration, and connecting the community with valuable resources.​Presented by Wells Fargo. This year, in partnership with Univision Foundation, we’re diving into the future of wealth, focusing on the transformative role of AI in the workforce, entrepreneurship, with a spotlight on sports and innovation.​📍 Location: ​Q-Branch ​200 E 6th St #310​Austin, TX 78701​Agenda - Espacio Latino ​March 8, 2025​✴️12:00 pm Doors open to the public​🪙12:50 pm Wealth Building and AI: The Future of Financial Growth​Moderator - Ramona Ortega​Arturo Cazares - LBAN​Luis Gonzalez - Wells Fargo​Betsabe Botaitis - Hedera ​Guillermo Diaz - Conectado​🌮1:20 pm Lunch Activation [Tacos & Tequila]​⚽2:00 pm Game Changers: Sports Meets Tech​Moderator - Jesse Martinez​Jennifer Yepez-Blundell​Camilo Isaza​Sandra Lopez​Alex Martinez​💪2:30 pm Breaking Barriers: Entrepreneurship​Moderator - Monica Talan​Sandra Velasquez​Maxeme Tuchman​Gustavo Suarez​Lala Elizondo ​📈3:00 pm Scaling Success​Moderator - Vicky Coello​Maribel Lara​HaKika DuBose Wise (Kika)​Robin Brooks, Senior Advisor, BLK GRVTY​💸3:30 pm Fueling Growth: VC and Capital Access​Moderator - Andres Morin​Jenny Flores​Laura Lucas​Erik Ibarra​🥂4:00 pm International Women’s DayToast​🪇4:30 pm Closing Party: DJ | Bin us in an all-day experience exploring the intersection of technology, wealth tech, sports, and entrepreneurship—and be part of the conversations shaping the future.​Learn, connect & support our thriving community. We will have great swag, food and drinks. See you in Austin! ​Follow us onInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/wealthbuild.ai​LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/wealthbuild/​Entry to the event is on a first-come-first-serve basis. We recommend arriving early to secure your spot. A ticket does not guarantee entry if capacity is reached.​LocationQ-Branch Global Collaboration Center200 E 6th St #310, Austin, TX 78701, USAPresented byTHRIVESubscribeHosted ByMonica TalanRamona Ortega, Esq.Mercedes Ortega-KennedyIzzy Tuccio 865 GoingKelsey Kearns, Pranay Baid and 863 othersContact the HostReport EventAICryptoWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: The Creators Playground: Brought to you by Kajabi
content: Explore EventsSign InHosted ByKajabiContact the HostReport EventArts & CultureWellnessFeatured in SXSWThe Creators Playground: Brought to you by KajabiHosted by KajabiRegister to See AddressAustin, TexasRegistrationWelcome! To join the event, please register below. RegisterYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​About the Event​Brought to you by Kajabi, this is THE ultimate event for creators who know how to have fun, push boundaries, and level up their craft!​We’re bringing together SXSW’s most talented creators, entrepreneurs, and industry insiders for a day packed with powerful panels, hands-on workshops, interactive games, and high-energy entertainment.​✨ What’s in store?🎯 Play big – Life-size lawn games & a ball pit (because who doesn’t want that photo?).🎨 Flex your creativity – Custom creator merch & personalized creator cards to showcase your achievements.📸 Snap content-worthy moments – Capture the energy in our life-size ball pit and interactive spaces.🍕 Fuel connections – Mingle over artisanal pizzas, craft cocktails, and wellness-infused spritzes.🎶 End on a high note – A DJ set, a dance floor, and unexpected surprises to keep the vibes alive.​🎤 Spotlight Sessions​💨 Set the vibe – Transformative breathwork and movement with Fish Fischer & Steven Jaggers from Somatic Release.​🩺 She MD Session – Expert-led discussions on women’s health topics like breast cancer, PCOS, fertility & more.​💗 From Niche to Noticed - A panel on how creators build engaged communities featuring Antoinette Hayford, Katie Xu, and Jessi Duley.​🎤 Colin & Samir go deep on creator success – Join them for an unfiltered fireside chat with Kajabi’s CEO, packed with real talk, raw insights, and actionable takeaways.​🏠 House Guest SXSW Edition - Join Dear Media's House Guest with Kenzie Elizabeth and Macy Thompson for a lively panel on life, relationships, friendships, and career! ​🔥 Dance takeover – Matt Steffanina cranks up the energy with a beginner dance workshop and DJ set—because boring isn’t in our vocabulary.​We don’t do ordinary. You in? 🚀​Whether you’re here to network, collab, or just jump in the ball pit, this is one event you don’t want to miss. Let’s celebrate our wins and shape the future of the creator commerce—together.​👉  Mark your calendar and register to get the secret location! 🎉 Hint: It's right on Rainey St., so no long treks—just good vibes! ​For updates, follow us on Instagram: @kajabiLocationPlease register to see the exact location of this event.Austin, TexasHosted ByKajabiContact the HostReport EventArts & CultureWellnessWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byNEW MOON FilmsSubscribeCreative Activism & Impact FilmmakingHosted ByNEW MOON FilmsContact the HostReport EventArts & CultureClimateFeatured in SXSWImpact Investment Lunch SXSW (Austin, TX)NEW MOON FilmsRegister to See AddressAustin, TexasGet TicketsApproval RequiredYour registration is subject to approval by the host.Ticket Price$100.00Welcome! To join the event, please get your ticket below.Request to JoinYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​Alongside the SXSW 2025 in Austin Texas with a focus on impact media opportunities. ​​Join us on March 8th for an Impact Investment luncheon with international leadership in funding for creative activism including members of NEW MOON's Impact Investment team and learn about different investment communities & trending impact opportunities in the US and abroad.​Includes a sneak peak program & trailer screening for NEW MOON's upcoming projects, and featured projects from participants (featured projects selected based on their support for United Nations Sustainable Development Goals).
