content: Explore EventsSign InHosted ByDivInc261 GoingKelsey Kearns, Claire England and 259 othersContact the HostReport EventFeatured in SXSWDivInc IWD Pop-Up 2025Hosted by DivInc506 Congress Ave.Austin, TexasRegistrationWelcome! To join the event, please register below. RegisterYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​DivInc is BACK at DASA with WNBA Legend Fran Harris 🏀​Join us in celebrating International Women's Day for a power-packed panel of CHAMPION athletes from the WNBA.​The WNBA nearly doubled its attendance from 2023 to 2024 and has seen a 41-fold increase since 2018.* These star players turned league executives have been on the front lines fueling decades of growth in the WNBA. On March 8th, they will come together to reflect on the past, present, and future of the league as it approaches the end of it's third decade of pro ball. You will love this conversation if you are:​A sports tech founder wanting to hear from athlete-entrepreneurs about the business of basketball​Are a sports tech investor wanting to meet founders and hear these leaders' hot takes on the future of the women's sports industry​Enthusiastic about seeing a WNBA franchise in Austin​​Agenda1:00pm-1:30pm Registration1:30pm-2:45pm Champions Panel2:45pm-4:00pm Networking Reception​​Featured Speakers​​Fran HarrisFounder, W in Austin1X WNBA Champion​Yolanda MooreCEO, Yolanda Moore Global Coaching & Consulting2X WNBA ChampionMonica RogersGeneral Manager, Toronto Tempo3X WNBA Champion​Moderator: Laura DixonCEO, Pro Sports Assembly​​​​About DivInc​Our mission is to generate social and economic equity through entrepreneurship. Our vision is a world that is authentically diverse, equitable and inclusive, where social and economic disparities no longer exist.​​​We occupy a unique space of providing resources to support underrepresented groups while creating a community. We are unique because we care about our founders at our core and reflect that in every action.About Fran Harris​“Well-behaved women rarely make history.”​Fran Harris is the Founder & CEO of Electra Beverages & Nutritionals, a better-for-you electrolyte drink company she launched in 2021 on ABC’s award-winning reality business show, SHARK TANK. She’s also Founder/Owner/Operator of The Athletic Club, a DFW-based portfolio of indoor and outdoor multi-sport sports complexes.​The former Procter & Gamble sales executive managed the highly coveted Kroger account, enroute to numerous sales awards with the consumer products giant before transitioning 100% into a multi-faceted sports career. She boasts more than 25 years of experience in sports – tech, marketing, management, operations, media, films and investing. As a sports executive, Fran has created, curated, managed and produced 300+ camps, combines, tournaments and events including with partners that include NBA, WNBA, NFL, iBall, Skills Pay Bills, City of Austin, LA Fitness, and 30+ universities including her alma mater, The University of Texas Longhorns.​Fran is the former host of HGTV’s renovation show, “Home Rules”, and has been featured in hundreds of media outlets as a business, sports and media thought leader including The Today Show, Good Morning America, CNN, CNBC, MSNBC, FOX Business News, and magazines Black Enterprise, Inc, and Entrepreneur. A former ESPN Announcer, Fran brings 20+ years on-air and production experience as a play-by-play announcer, color analyst, studio host, sideline reporter, game commentator, writer and producer. She’s currently a color analyst for the WNBA’s Dallas Wings.​At the University of Texas, Fran led the Longhorns to an undefeated (34-0) NCAA Championship in 1986. She earned ALL Southwest Conference honors in 1984, 85 and 86, and was the Player of the Year in 1986. She finished her career at Texas as the fourth leading scorer in program history with 1,798 points. A decade later she played on the WNBA's first championship team with the Houston Comets. Fran earned a BA, Journalism and MA, Journalism from the University of Texas at Austin, and a Master of Science in Tech Commercialization from The University of Texas McCombs School of Business. The author of more than 20 books including HOUSTON BY MORNING, a novel set in the world of women’s pro hoops, Fran’s also a filmmaker and content creator, who produced and directed A LEAGUE OF OUR OWN, a feature length documentary about women’s professional basketball, which debuted in May 2024. Today she’s leading the charge to bring a WNBA expansion team to Austin, Texas.About Monica Rogers​​Monica Rogers is a proven and accomplished professional both on and off the basketball court. She is a 7-year WNBA veteran and 3-time WNBA champion, who was recently appointed as Toronto Tempo's first General Manger, the WNBA’s newest franchise alongside Portland and Golden State. She previously served as Vice President, Assistant General Manager for the Phoenix Mercury. She oversees scouting/talent ID, salary cap management, basketball operations, and is a liaison between business and basketball.​Prior to this, she served as the Elite Basketball Women’s Operations Lead for the NBA’s International Basketball Operations Department. In this role, she aims to grow the game of basketball internationally at the grassroots level, with a focus on girls.​Before switching to the sports business side, Monica was an NCAA Womens’ Basketball assistant coach for the University of Virginia and Liberty University for 3 total seasons. Before her coaching career, she played professional basketball overseas and in the WNBA for the Minnesota Lynx from 2010-2015, and the Seattle Storm form 2015-2016.​Monica graduated from the University of Virginia where she played for Hall of Fame coach, Debbie Ryan. In her freshman run, she was named the ACC Rookie of the Year. In the 2007-08 season she was named to the ACC All-Defensive Team and also notched her 1000th point. As a junior, Monica was named to the All-ACC defensive team and was also rewarded with a spot on the All-ACC first team as the league's top scorer. As a senior Monica was named ACC Player of the Year, ACC Defensive Player of the Year, and National Defensive Player of the Year.​After a successful college career, she was selected 2nd overall by the Minnesota Lynx in the 2010 WNBA Draft. In July of 2015, Monica was traded to the Seattle Storm where she was able to play for her longtime mentor and fellow University of Virginia alumni, Jenny Boucek. During this season she was voted by her peers to serve as Secretary-Treasurer for the Women’s National Basketball Player’s Association, where she was responsible for quarterly meeting notes and monitoring financial reporting in strict compliance with the US Department of Labor.​Monica is a strong advocate of women and girls health and served as an ambassador for womenshealth.gov and girlshealth.gov for several years. She is the co-founder of 1FOR1 Project, which focuses on girls having more visibility and access to women in professional sports careers.​​About Yolanda Moore​Yolanda is a two-time WNBA Champion, award-winning coach, and ESPN basketball college basketball analyst. Despite facing challenges, having two babies and three knee surgeries during her collegiate career, she excelled in the WNBA as part of the Houston Comets' back-to-back championship teams in 1997 and 1998. Her international experience includes playing in both Europe and Asia.​An accomplished athlete, Yolanda was inducted into the Ole Miss Sports Hall of Fame in 2010 and named an SEC Legend in 2012. She has five seasons of experience as a head women's college basketball coach, leading both the LSU-Eunice and Clark Atlanta programs to conference championships. At Clark Atlanta, she garnered the 2018 SIAC Coach of the Year award for transforming the team from "worst to first," culminating in NCAA Tournament qualification.​As a leadership and career development professional, she has empowered over 1,000 individuals to enhance their leadership and communication skills while crafting tailored career development strategies. With a strong foundation in workforce development, Yolanda creates transformative learning experiences across various sectors, including sports, education, and business. She specializes in identifying performance and leadership gaps, helping organizations develop effective programming to strengthen employee relations and leadership capabilities. Yolanda also designs programs to support youth in alternative schools and juvenile centers, enabling them to discover their strengths, set goals, and create a vision for their futures.​About Laura Dixon​Laura Dixon is a high-value, trusted advisor in the sports industry. She grows sports-centric businesses by building strong relationships and sustainable financial strategies. Laura is CEO and co-founder of Pro Sports Assembly, the industry association for professional sports organizations and business leaders. She is also the Founder of long game ventures, a firm that guides and invests in businesses committed to making an impact through sport. ​She is a Past Chair of The Texas Lyceum and serves on the national Board of Directors for the PLAYS Coalition. She has also served alongside the US State Department on sports envoys, fellowships, and programs connecting sports leaders and organizations across the globe. Prior to long game ventures, she served as head of external relations for Spurs Sports and Entertainment, leading government and public affairs and serving as executive director of the Spurs Foundation. When Laura joined Spurs Sports and Entertainment, she was a partner at Victor Credo, an advisory firm that supported talent agents, high profile coaches and athletes in advancing their careers, social impact, and off-court business ventures. Her clients included NBA All-Stars, Olympic Gold Medalists, NCAA Champions, youth sport organizations, coaches associations, municipalities, school districts, universities and North American indigenous tribes. Ultimately, her forte is partnering with sport executives to build coalitions, set a vision, develop a plan, and execute with excellence. In doing so, she enjoys helping clients make lasting connections with external stakeholders and organizations to enhance their business reputation and impact. She possesses an exceedingly high track record of success in leading ventures at the intersection of sport and social impact.​Laura received an MBA from the University of Texas at Austin, a BS from Texas Tech University and executive certificates from Texas Christian University, Southern Methodist University, and the University of Kentucky. She was in the first cohort to receive a Certified Sports Event Executive designation and Certificate of Inclusive Leadership in professional sports. Throughout her career, Laura has served on numerous state, municipal and nonprofit boards.​​​🚘​ PARKING INFO​​​​Please take advantage of public transit, micro-mobility, and bicycle options if you are able!​​​​DASA has a discounted parking rate for event guests at the Littlefield Garage at 508 Brazos (entrance on Brazos between 5th and 6th St, west side). Please follow the instructions below.​​​​​Additional parking is available at Indeed Tower Garage, 200 W. 6th, 600 Congress Ave Garage, and City Hall Garage, 301 W 2nd. Most of these options have a max rate of $33 for the day.​​​​​See you soon!​​​​-​DivInc​​​Discounted Parking​​​​​Littlefield Garage @ 508 Brazos St, Austin, TX 78701​​​​​A parking validation is offered for $6 for your first 2 hours. After the first 2 hours, the rate resets to $6 per hour.​​​​​1. UPON ENTRY insert credit card at the garage. **The last 4 digits of credit card is your ticket.**​​​​​2. UPON EXIT visit the Flash Valet Login website at https://v.flashvalet.com/Secure/Login.aspx​​​​​ Login email: hello@downtownaustin.com​​​​​ Login password: test123​​​​​3. ENTER TICKET NUMBER: Use the last 4 digits of the credit card used for entry.​​​​​4. Validation complete​*Source: https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/Deloitte/us/Documents/consulting/athena-pledge-rev.pdfLocation506 Congress Ave.Austin, TX 78701, USAHosted ByDivInc261 GoingKelsey Kearns, Claire England and 259 othersContact the HostReport EventWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: ✨💛 Austin IWD Trail Walk & Social | March
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byCity Lead EventsSubscribeHosted ByKyla BrozWomen and ClimateMichelle Li22 GoingEsther O, Michu Benaim Steiner and 20 othersContact the HostReport EventClimateWellnessFeatured in SXSW✨💛 Austin IWD Trail Walk & Social | MarchCity Lead EventsRegister to See AddressAustin, TexasRegistration ClosedThis event is not currently taking registrations. You may contact the host or subscribe to receive updates.About Event​Welcome to our Austin International Women's Day Trail Walk & Social for March!​Kick off International Women’s Day celebrations with fresh air, great company, and inspiring conversations! Whether you’re a climate pro or just curious, this is the perfect chance to connect and unwind. Plus, we’re thrilled to have Michelle Li, co-founder of Women and Climate, co-hosting ahead of her SXSW appearance—don’t miss this unforgettable day of community and celebration!​If you are looking for an opportunity to talk climate with professionals identifying as women or non-binary, you are in the right place! No climate experience necessary.​Our gatherings are a fun way to make new friends and chat about all topics including climate. See a summary of our past events here​For alerts on future events and access to our free Slack Community, head over to our main site here​Meetup Plan: ​Meet at Sand Beach Park (just next to the Lamar Pedestrian Bridge) at 1:30 PM for a trail walk around Lady Bird Lake. ​Then we will make our way over to the Better Half Coffee&Cocktails & Hold Out Brewing at 3:00 PM for drinks and bites.​Host(s): Meetup organized by WAC Austin City Lead, Kyla Broz and Women and Climate Co-Founder, Michelle Li.​Networking: We will send out an email pre-event with attendee names and LinkedIn profiles so you can connect in advance :)​Payment: Everyone will pay for their own drink and food directly to the restaurant. ​About Women and Climate: The Women and Climate community provides a joyful and safe space for women and non-binary professionals from around the world to learn and talk about climate. No climate experience necessary. We are a 501c3 non-profit. Learn more here: https://www.womenandclimate.co/​Monthly Virtual Gathering: Join our free monthly virtual gathering to connect with our global community of women professionals! https://www.womenandclimate.co/community-gathering ​Subscribe to our monthly newsletter: https://www.womenandclimate.co/past-newsletters​Disclaimer: Views and opinions expressed at this event do not necessarily represent those of Women and Climate. Women and Climate events hosted by City Leads are not affiliated with other corporations or organizations.LocationPlease register to see the exact location of this event.Austin, TexasPresented byCity Lead EventsSubscribeHosted ByKyla BrozWomen and ClimateMichelle Li22 GoingEsther O, Michu Benaim Steiner and 20 othersContact the HostReport EventClimateWellnessWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: Bold Prompts: Meet Germany’s Top AI Startups
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byGerman AcceleratorSubscribeGerman Accelerator helps high-potential German startups scale into leading innovation hubs across the globe. German Accelerator is proudly financed by the German Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Climate Action (BMWK).29 GoingLida, Mitsuo Okada, PhD and 27 othersContact the HostReport EventAIFeatured in SXSWBold Prompts: Meet Germany’s Top AI StartupsGerman AcceleratorSpeakeasyAustin, TexasRegistrationWelcome! To join the event, please register below. RegisterYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​Germany's most ambitious AI startups are taking the stage at SXSW to showcase the future of artificial intelligence. As part of German Accelerator’s U.S. Market Discovery AI program, these founders are ready to introduce groundbreaking solutions designed to make an impact in the U.S. market.​​This event is more than just a pitch session – it’s an opportunity to gain insight into Germany’s AI landscape, connect with industry leaders, and explore collaborations that drive innovation forward. Whether you’re an investor, a corporate executive, or an AI enthusiast, this is your chance to engage with the technologies shaping tomorrow.​​What to Expect​Opening remarks by Kai Hennig, German Consul General in Houston​Live startup pitches featuring cutting-edge AI solutions​A deep dive into the trends defining Germany’s AI ecosystem​Opportunities to connect with founders, investors, and industry experts​​Pitching Startups​Blinkin​Catch​Deep Care​Exaia Technologies​LexaTexer​Neo Commerce​Synera​SWAN Beauty Tech​Talonic​Tracebloc​​This event will take place at German Haus at SXSW, the premier destination for German innovation, entrepreneurship, and networking during SXSW.​​Important Information:​SXSW badge holders are granted primary access​First come, first served – Due to high demand and limited capacity, we strongly recommend arriving early. Please note that admission is not guaranteed even with a ticket, so ensure you arrive on time! Be prepared for potential waiting times at the entrance.​By attending, you consent to being photographed and filmed. German Accelerator may use these images and videos for marketing purposes.​Attendees must be 21 or older.​By registering, you agree to the collection and processing of your personal data (including name, company, and email address) by German Accelerator, in compliance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Your information will only be used for event communication, coordination, and related follow-ups.​About German Accelerator​German Accelerator empowers German startups to scale globally. Through highly-customized programs, mentoring from local experts, and access to a vast network of business partners and investors, German Accelerator takes high-potential companies on a fast-paced learning journey into the world's leading innovation hubs. German Accelerator is run by Start2 Group and is proudly financed by the German Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Climate Action (BMWK).​About GERMAN HAUS​The GERMAN HAUS is the main venue of the joint German presentation at SXSW and it will feature a variety of curated networking events, roundtables, presentations, and music performances, creating a unique environment for professional exchange, international networking, and the discovery of new creative partnerships. Be sure to explore the full program and find ways to actively participate in our events. We look forward to seeing you in Austin!LocationSpeakeasy412 Congress Ave. D, Austin, TX 78701, USASpeakeasy TerracePresented byGerman AcceleratorSubscribeGerman Accelerator helps high-potential German startups scale into leading innovation hubs across the globe. Please choose your desired ticket type:General​Require Approval VIP​Require Approval Friends of Andrew and Blindspot, please apply here.Request to JoinYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​​​LUMOS HOUSE PRESENTS:​Lumos House Opening Night​Welcome to Lumos House, where ambition meets its match. On opening night, founders, creators, tech innovators, and investors converge in a private mansion built for connection and influence. This is more than an event—it’s the start of a movement, where the brightest minds in business and media come together to redefine what’s next.​What is this?: Part of the invite-only event series, Lumos House, Opening Night is our kick off event. Join the sharpest tech, business, and music leaders for a one-of-a-kind night of connection. Where is this?: This event is taking place at a luxe Austin property during SXSW 2025.Who's attending?: A curated list of notable technology founders, investors leaders in media and entertainment, and digital creators.*We appreciate your patience as Lumos House carefully selects attendees from over 1,000+ RSVPs.​About our Hosts & Sponsors:​​​Andrew Yeung is the founder of Fibe (a portfolio of events companies including Andrew's Mixers, The Junto Series, and Lumos House). He is also a Partner at Next Wave NYC, a pre-seed/seed found backed by Flybridge Capital. Andrew's hosted 100+ events for 30k+ tech founders and professionals in 8 cities that were featured in Bloomberg, Business Insider, Fast Company, and Fortune Magazine. Business Insider dubbed him the "Gatsby of Silicon Alley."​​​​​​​Get on the list for future events: Twitter • Instagram • Website​Blindspot is a platform that helps any advertiser optimize their Digital Out of Home budgets by 60% or more. Over 1.500.000 digital billboards are accessible through Blindspot. The platform is being used by over 25,000 advertisers, from SMBs to startups and household names such as Rihanna, Airbnb, Snoop Dogg, American Airlines, United Nations, Morning Brew, Universal Music, Samsung, TikTok and more. Learn more here.​Notion is trusted and loved by thousands of startups around the world for everything from engineering specs to new hire onboarding to fundraising.​Since you’re here, you’re eligible for our special Notion community offer: Get up to 6 months of Notion with unlimited AI, FREE.​👉 Apply here – choose Andrew Yeung in the partner drop down and use the code NotionXAY.​Cooley works with startups to launch dynamic new ventures and take them forward. Our work often begins prior to company formation and progresses through the full evolution of a startup’s life. Cooley has been ranked the #1 firm for VC-backed IPOs for 15+ years by IPO Vital Signs. Check out Cooley’s award-winning free legal resource for founders at cooleygo.com, which offers a range of legal resources to entrepreneurs of all sizes – from formation to M&A and IPO.​​Agree.com is giving away free e-signature to everyone, with integrated invoicing and payments. Today is the last day you'll ever pay for DocuSign! And, for all attendees of the Lumos House this year at SXSW, Agree™ is upgrading everyone's account to a "Teams" plan free for a year. Book a demo today and we'll even waive the first three months of any transaction fees. Book a demo now.LocationPlease register to see the exact location of this event.Austin, TexasPresented byLumos House @ Austin 2025SubscribeAn invite-only event series for the most visionary founders, builders, and leaders in media & tech. name: The Prelude at Lumos House
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byLumos House @ Austin 2025SubscribeAn invite-only event series for the most visionary founders, builders, and leaders in media & tech. Powered by Blindspot and Andrew Yeung, set in an exclusive mansion—free to attend.Hosted ByAndrew YeungBogdan SavoneaMatei PsattaCherae RobinsonKevin MorrisJesse MiddletonDorothy ChangDrew Parten90 GoingChalique Seabron, Sofia Rodriguez and 88 othersContact the HostReport EventAIFeatured in SXSWThe Prelude at Lumos HouseLumos House @ Austin 2025Register to See AddressAustin, TexasRegistrationWelcome! Please choose your desired ticket type:General​Require Approval VIP​Require Approval Friends of the hosts, please apply here.Request to JoinYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​The Prelude at Lumos House​Start your SXSW Sunday Funday off with The Prelude by Flybridge and Next Wave NYC, a live music experience where founders, VCs, and creatives take the stage to showcase their musical talents. Coinciding with the launch of the AI x Creativity: Future of Consumer Experiences Report, The Prelude explores how creativity, technology, and human connection are driving the next frontier of consumer experiences.​We're bringing NYC creative energy to Austin, join us and enjoy live performances, fresh ideas, and great conversations with some of the most creative minds in tech, venture, and beyond.​Coffee, light breakfast, and good vibes included.​Interested in performing at The Prelude? Apply Here​Lumos House is an invite-only event series for the most visionary founders, builders, and leaders in media & tech. Powered by Blindspot and Andrew Yeung, set in an exclusive mansion—free to attend.​​What to expect:​Founders, Investors, and Creatives​Live Music and Hidden Talents​Breakfast Bites and Plenty of Coffee​Morning Vibes to Kickoff Your Sunday Funday​​Details:​​​​​​📅 Date: Mar 9, 2025​​​​​​⏰ Time: 8:30am - 11:00am​​🍽️ Venue: Lumos House in Austin (address shown if approved).​About our Hosts & Sponsors:​​​Andrew Yeung is the founder of Fibe (a portfolio of events companies including Andrew's Mixers, The Junto Series, and Lumos House). He is also a Partner at Next Wave NYC, a pre-seed/seed found backed by Flybridge Capital. Andrew's hosted 100+ events for 30k+ tech founders and professionals in 8 cities that were featured in Bloomberg, Business Insider, Fast Company, and Fortune Magazine. Business Insider dubbed him the "Gatsby of Silicon Alley."​____​​Blindspot is a platform that helps any advertiser optimize their Digital Out of Home budgets by 60% or more. Over 1.500.000 digital billboards are accessible through Blindspot. The platform is being used by over 25,000 advertisers, from SMBs to startups and household names such as Rihanna, Airbnb, Snoop Dogg, American Airlines, United Nations, Morning Brew, Universal Music, Samsung, TikTok and more. Learn more here.​____Next Wave NYC is a pre-seed fund focused on the next generation of iconic companies built in NYC. Our investment partners include some of the best founders and operators from NYC's tech scene over the last decade.​____​Flybridge is an early-stage venture fund that backs ambitious founders building our AI future. We've backed incredible companies like MongoDB, Nasuni, BetterCloud, Bowery, Codecademy and Chief – typically leading the seed rounds. Through Next Wave Funds (XFactor Ventures, Next Wave NYC, The Graduate Syndicate, and Next Wave Operators) we back companies tackling a diverse set of problems at the earliest stage through a curated community of investment partners poised to help founders win.​____​Rho - From two-person startups to public companies, Rho is the banking platform with everything businesses need to manage cash, control spend, and automate finance busywork. Rho offers corporate cards, banking, treasury, expense management, AP, accounting automation, and more in one integrated platform backed by award-winning support.Rho is a fintech company, not a bank. Checking and card services provided by Webster Bank, N.A., member FDIC; savings account services provided by American Deposit Management, LLC, and its partner banks.​____​Cooley works with startups to launch dynamic new ventures and take them forward. Our work often begins prior to company formation and progresses through the full evolution of a startup’s life. Cooley has been ranked the #1 firm for VC-backed IPOs for 15+ years by IPO Vital Signs. RegisterYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​🌎 Casa TechMex 2025 – Where Innovation Meets Opportunity!​Join us at Casa TechMex, the premier gathering for Mexican entrepreneurs, technologists, and investors! This full-day event showcases the best of Mexico’s innovation ecosystem through engaging panels, networking opportunities, and the TechMex Pitch Competition—where top startups compete for visibility and connections with investors.​📅 Event Highlights​🔥 Panel Discussions & Fireside Chats – Hear from industry leaders on key trends shaping the future of tech and entrepreneurship.🌐 Networking & Community Building – Connect with fellow innovators, investors, and thought leaders in a vibrant setting.🚀 TechMex Pitch Competition – Witness the top Mexican-founded startups pitch their ideas in front of investors and industry experts.​📍 How to Attend​Registration is via Capital Factory House, granting you access not just to Casa TechMex, but also to Capital Factory’s full lineup of programming.​💡 Don’t miss this chance to be part of the movement shaping the future of Mexican tech on the global stage!​Register here: https://techmexaustin.org/LocationCapital Factory701 Brazos St, Austin, TX 78701, USACasa TechMex wil be part of Capital Factory House, we will be on floor 8th (Captain America room) during the morning, and floor 16th (ACL room) during the afternoonPresented byTechMex AustinSubscribeTechMex is a non-profit community for mexicans in the tech industry living in the Austin area.Hosted ByHector Ramirez138 GoingOleksii Avramenko, Luis Alanis and 136 othersContact the HostReport EventWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: Fediverse House (All Events)
content: Explore EventsSign InHosted ByFlipboard + SurfMarci McCueContact the HostReport Event人工智能Featured in SXSWFediverse House (All Events)Hosted by Flipboard + Surf & Marci McCue412 Congress Ave.Austin, TexasRegistrationWelcome! To join the event, please register below. RegisterYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​Join us to learn about this brave new world of decentralized social media and why it promises a better way for consumers, creators, brands, and even democracy itself.​Located just three blocks from the Austin Convention Center, at the Speakeasy (412 Congress Ave.), the Fediverse House creates a space for strategic conversations, networking opportunities, and refreshments throughout the day. You’ll hear from visionaries, builders, and open-source advocates from places like Bluesky, Threads, and the Social Web Foundation.Please RSVP to this event as a whole and/or any specific segments you plan on attending. ​Sunday, March 9​Sunday, March 9​Accelerating Innovation Across the Open Social Web (Part 1) / RSVP​9am: Fediverse House at SXSW is open! Stop by for coffee and a morning of inspirational talks on the future of social and the internet.9:30am: Welcome from Mike McCue, CEO and Co-founder, Flipboard9:45am: "A Better Web Is Possible" with Molly White, Researcher, Software Engineer and Writer​10am - 11am: David Imel’s "Fediverse Corner" with Mike Masnick, CEO and Founder, Techdirt, and Board of Directors, Bluesky; Evan Prodromou, Co-author ActivityPub and Research Director, Social Web Foundation; and Peter Cottle, Software Engineer, Threads11:30am - 1:30pm: Networking session, presented by the Social Web Foundation ​2pm - 3pm: Developer meetup and book signing with ActivityPub Co-author Evan Prodromou / RSVP​Accelerating Innovation Across the Open Social Web (Part 2) / RSVP4:30pm: Pre-chat Bluesky cocktail ​5pm - 5:45pm: Fireside chat with Bluesky CTO Paul Frazee and Mike McCue ​6pm - 7pm: "Dot Social Live" with David Imel, Co-host, Waveform podcast, and Mike McCueThe Open Social Social / RSVP​7pm - 10pm: Evening party — refreshments and tunes with your new fedi friends ​Monday, March 10 ​The New Playbook / RSVP9am - 9:45am: “From Walled Gardens to the Open Social Web: The Next Evolution of Brand Storytelling” with Gina Michnowicz, CEO and CCO at The Craftsman Agency10am - 10:45am: “Creators and the Fediverse,” with Peter Cottle, Software Engineer, Threads, and Jim Louderback, Editor and CEO, Inside the Creator Economy, moderated by Shira Lazar, Creator and Founder of What's Trending​11am - 11:45am: “Building Communities Across the Social Web,” with Rose Wang, COO, Bluesky, and Andy Piper, Developer Relations Lead, Mastodon, moderated by Mia Quagliarello, Head of Creator Community, Flipboard​12:30pm - 1pm: Demo of Surf*, a new kind of browser unifying the social web, with Mike McCue* To get access before SXSW, go here and use SURFSXSW as the referral code.​Publishers in the Fediverse / RSVP​3pm: Fireside chat with Cory Doctorow, Journalist and Sci-Fi Author, and Mike McCue ​4pm - 4:45pm: “Publishers: Audience and Autonomy” with 404 Media’s Jason Koebler, Texas Observer’s Kit O’Connell, and PMC's Parker Ortolani​404 Media Takeover and Evening Party  / RSVP5pm - 5:45pm: "Generative AI Is Eating the Internet": 404 Media’s Sam Cole and Jason Koebler and Blood in the Machine’s Brian Merchant discuss how AI slop is taking over the internet, and how humans can fight back.6pm - 6:45 pm: "Indie Media Happy Hour and Q&A": A free-flowing discussion about how to set up and run an independent media outlet featuring 404 Media and friends ​7pm - 10pm: Evening party hosted by your friends at 404 MediaLocation412 Congress Ave.Austin, TX 78704, USASpeakeasy https://speakeasyaustin.com/Hosted ByFlipboard + SurfMarci McCueContact the HostReport Event人工智能What's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: Going BIG in TEXAS - Slovak House
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented bySlovak PROSubscribeSlovak PRO is a community-based non-profit 501(c)(3) organization that offers professional, cultural, and educational opportunities for Slovaks in North America and back home.Hosted BySlovak PRO210 GoingCraig Cummings, Tomas Gregor and 208 othersContact the HostReport EventAIFeatured in SXSWGoing BIG in TEXAS - Slovak HouseSlovak PROQ-Branch Global Collaboration CenterAustin, TexasRegistrationApproval RequiredYour registration is subject to approval by the host.Welcome! To join the event, please register below. Request to JoinYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​Going BIG in Texas! ​Bridging Slovakia & Texas for Unstoppable Business Growth​Texas is where businesses grow fast, and Slovakia is where world-class ideas and innovations come from. Join us at Slovak House 2025, a high-energy, one-day event designed for entrepreneurs, investors, and professionals eager to expand in Texas - the land of limitless opportunities!​This all day networking event is about real opportunities. You’ll hear from Slovak companies breaking into the U.S. market, meet people who know how to succeed in Texas, and get straight talk from those who’ve done it.​If you want to learn how to expand, invest, or partner in one of the most business-friendly states in the U.S., this is the room you need to be in. ​WHAT TO EXPECT​✅ Texas Secretary of State Jane Nelson on what makes Texas a land of opportunity✅ Practical panels on navigating the Texas business landscape✅ Slovak entrepreneurs proving they can compete and win in the U.S.✅ Inspiring TEDx talks from Slovaks making waves in the U.S.✅ Rapid-fire pitch sessions – 15 companies, 60 seconds each✅ Plenty of time to meet people who matterWHY ATTEND?​Because this is where real conversations happen about doing business in Texas. You’ll walk away with new connections, better insights, and maybe even your next big opportunity.​Don’t miss this chance to take your business global - Going BIG in Texas starts at Slovak House!​See you in Austin.​​PROGRAM - SLOVAK HOUSE​📌 10:30 AM – Welcome to Slovak HouseRadovan Javorcik - Ambassador of Slovakia to the United StatesAndrea Hrusovska - Chief People Officer at Slovak PRO📌 10:50 AM – Business Friendly SlovakiaVladimir Lackovic - Special Representative to the U.S. for Trade and Investment, SARIO - Slovak Investment and Trade Development AgencyNikola Kmecova - FDI Consultant, SARIO - Slovak Investment and Trade Development Agency​📌 11:20 AM – TEDx Talk: Slovak Success in the U.S.Vlado Hruda - Product Manager, Miro a Marian Stahovec - Director of Finance, DELL ​📌 11:40 AM – Quick Pitch Session15 Slovak companies, 60 seconds each​📌 12:00 PM – PANEL 1: Practical Foundations for Success in TexasPanel of lawyers: Dave Quinn, John Sigety & Martin ValkoModerator: Erin McKelvey - President, EACC of Texas📌 13:00 PM – Networking Lunch​📌 2:00 PM – PANEL 2: The Austin Ecosystem – Your Growth PartnerMarcos Cervantes - CEO of Q-BranchMortada Mohamed - President, World Affairs Council of AustinScott Smith - Director of Economic Development, City of Cedar ParkDavid Steele - Director, Plug and Play Sportstech​📌 3:00 PM – KEYNOTE ADDRESS: Texas – The Land of OpportunityTexas Secretary of State Jane Nelson​📌 3:20 PM – Coffee & Networking​📌 3:40 PM – Quick Pitch Session (Round 2)15 Slovak companies, 60 seconds each​📌 4:00 PM – Achieving Success in AmericaGrant Mitterlehner - CEO of MittGroup​📌 4:30 PM – TEDx Talk: Slovak AI Innovation Changing AmericaNiko Dubovsky - Co-founder of SuperCity AI ​📌 4:40 PM – Closing Remarks​📌 5:00 - 8:00 PM – Networking with Slovak food and drinksOrganizers & Partners:​SARIO – Slovak Investment and Trade Development Agency | Slovak PRO | Embassy of Slovakia in Washington D.C. | Consulate of Slovakia in Texas | European Union | Programme Slovakia | HR4ULocationQ-Branch Global Collaboration Center200 E 6th St #310, Austin, TX 78701, USAEntrance through Neighborhood CaféPresented bySlovak PROSubscribeSlovak PRO is a community-based non-profit 501(c)(3) organization that offers professional, cultural, and educational opportunities for Slovaks in North America and back home.Hosted BySlovak PRO210 GoingCraig Cummings, Tomas Gregor and 208 othersContact the HostReport EventAIWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: Breaking the 18-Month CMO Curse: Redefining the Future of Marketing Leadership
content: Explore EventsSign InHosted BySandra LopezBrandon RodriguezKatherine StruveContact the HostReport EventFeatured in SXSWBreaking the 18-Month CMO Curse: Redefining the Future of Marketing LeadershipHosted by Sandra Lopez, Brandon Rodriguez & Katherine Struve800 Brazos St ste 300Austin, TexasRegistrationApproval RequiredYour registration is subject to approval by the host.Welcome! To join the event, please register below. Request to JoinYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​CMO Mixer: No sales, just insights​Join us in the heart of Austin for an exclusive, Jeffersonian-style breakfast that brings together forward-thinking CMOs and marketing executives to explore the critical challenges and opportunities that are facing our industry.​This 90-minute session will delve into the core issues of power, influence, and C-suite survival for marketing leaders. We'll examine the evolving dynamics of the CMO role and discuss actionable strategies for extending CMO tenure and securing board-level positions.​This closed-door, peer-only breakfast session will confront the critical issues impacting CMOs today:​The Breaking Point: Analyzing the systemic challenges that can hinder even the most brilliant CMOs in today's business environment.​The Power of Definition: A candid discussion on whether the CMO title has become a career liability and how to redefine the role for maximum impact.​Next-Generation Leadership: Examining emerging leadership roles such as Chief Growth Officer, Chief Experience Architect, and Chief Customer Officer, and their implications for the future of marketing.​Networking & Refreshments:​Breakfast will be catered by Swedish Hill.​Programming will start at 10 am CST.​Our Commitment:​This is a vendor-free environment. There will be no sales pitches, no product demonstrations, and no solicitations of any kind. Just real talk and valuable insights shared among peers.Location800 Brazos St ste 300Austin, TX 78701, USAHosted BySandra LopezBrandon RodriguezKatherine StruveContact the HostReport EventWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: SXSW Early-Stage B2B SaaS Founders & Funders Breakfast Club
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byForum Events SubscribeYour go-to spot for all of Forum's events, both virtual and IRL!Hosted ByNia PryceBrandon Middleton-PrattMicrosoft for StartupsVanessa StephensAnish ZutéGarrison GowensContact the HostReport EventFeatured in SXSWSXSW Early-Stage B2B SaaS Founders & Funders Breakfast ClubForum Events Register to See AddressAustin, TexasRegistrationApproval RequiredYour registration is subject to approval by the host.Welcome! To join the event, please register below. Request to JoinYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​Join us for a morning of meaningful connections at SXSW!​We’re bringing together the B2B SaaS community for an exclusive breakfast designed for pre-Series B founders and early-stage investors who are actively building, funding, and scaling the next wave of SaaS innovation. We’re especially committed to supporting underrepresented founders and investors in tech—this is a space for genuine connections, not just another networking event.​Hosted in partnership with Forum Ventures, Drive Capital, and Capitalize VC, and proudly sponsored by Wilson Sonsini, Cake Equity, and Microsoft for Startups, this event is a chance to fuel up, share insights, and build relationships that drive impact.​📍 Location: Austin, Texas🗓 Date: Sunday, March 9th⏰ Time: 9:30 AM – 11:30 AM​Whether you're a founder refining your go-to-market strategy or an investor seeking top-tier early-stage deal flow, this event is built for real conversations and real connections.​​APPROVED GUESTS​​Application DOES NOT guarantee attendance. ​​Spaces for this event are limited to maintain the quality of interactions and aim to ensure every participant receives optimum value. Register now - we hope to see you there.​Admitted guests will be notified via event approval (with a calendar invite).​​NOTE: Invites are non-transferable. NO +1s (space is very intimate, and capacity is strictly enforced).​About Forum Ventures​Forum Ventures is the leading early-stage fund, program and community for B2B SaaS startups based in New York, San Francisco, and Toronto. Founded in 2014, we’re on a mission to make the B2B SaaS journey easier, more accessible and successful for early-stage founders. From our Studio to Accelerator to Pre-Seed programming, we have the resources and network to help founders navigate the early stages of their founder journey.​Forum is investing in 85+ SaaS companies this year.  Pitch Us here.​About Microsoft for Startups ​Microsoft for Startups helps founders accelerate startup growth with up to $150k in Azure credits, access to the latest AI models including Meta, Mistral, Cohere, and Phi-3 small language models, and free 1:1 technical sessions with engineering and business teams to help you build and grow your business. Ready to build? Apply in minutes today.​​About WSGR​​Wilson Sonsini is the premier legal advisor to technology, life sciences, and growth enterprises worldwide, as well as the venture firms, private equity firms, and investment banks that finance them. We represent companies at every stage of development, from entrepreneurial start-ups to multibillion-dollar global corporations.​About Cake Equity​Cake is an easy-to-use alternative to Carta, built for scaling startups. Cake lets you set up your cap table quickly, keep your team motivated in real time, and offers straightforward pricing with hands-on support whenever you need it. ​They support over 17,000 startups globally and can facilitate stock grants across more than 50 countries. ​Best of all, it’s free to sign up and get started. To unlock 20% off for one year on any paid plan, reach out to Garrison Gowens at garrison@cakeequity.com.LocationPlease register to see the exact location of this event.Austin, TexasPresented byForum Events SubscribeYour go-to spot for all of Forum's events, both virtual and IRL!Hosted ByNia PryceBrandon Middleton-PrattMicrosoft for StartupsVanessa StephensAnish ZutéGarrison GowensContact the HostReport EventWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: Brews & Bots @ SXSW '25 (unofficial)
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented bySightboxSubscribeVision for venture.Hosted ByCharlie HinojosaCynthia HinojosaDakota Moore279 GoingRodrigo Paredes, Austin Langley and 277 othersContact the HostReport EventAIFeatured in SXSWBrews & Bots @ SXSW '25 (unofficial)Sightbox3901 Woodbury DrAustin, TexasRegistrationEvent FullIf you’d like, you can join the waitlist.Please click on the button below to join the waitlist. You will be notified if additional spots become available.Join WaitlistYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​Join us for Brews & Bots @ SXSW '25 (Unofficial) on March 9, 2025, at The Next Practices Group in Austin, TX, hosted by Sightbox. This casual mixer-style event brings together innovators, AI and agent startups, and tech enthusiasts for an afternoon of networking, live demos, and insightful discussions with notable speakers. From craft beers to coffee “brews” provided by Luna Espresso (generously sponsored by Veracode), enjoy drinks and snacks while exploring the cutting edge of AI technology. ​SEEKING ADDITIONAL SPONSORSEmail inside [at] sightbox.co for details.​The gathering kicks off at 11:00 AM, with demos and panel discussions beginning at 12:00 PM. Don’t miss this opportunity to dive into the future of AI in a fun, approachable setting—and raise a cup (or glass) to innovation!​FEATURED STARTUPS​Motogo Systems​POD Health AI​Scalafai​Lambda Curry​StorySense AI​SEEKING AI STARTUPS TO DEMO​Startups can apply to present at no cost. Please apply to demo here: https://sbox.us/request-demo​About Sightbox, your Host​Sightbox is a California-based agency at the forefront of bringing the spirit of Silicon Valley to Austin. With deep roots in the startup ecosystem, we specialize in helping innovative companies build powerful brands and create impactful digital experiences. Our team has extensive experience working with early-stage startups and established tech leaders, with a particular focus on the rapidly evolving AI landscape. At Sightbox, we combine world-class design, strategy, and development to empower visionary founders and their groundbreaking ideas. We’re thrilled to host Brews & Bots @ SXSW '25 and foster meaningful connections in the thriving Austin tech community.​About The Next Practices Group, your Co-Host​The Next Practices Group is a dynamic ecosystem of creative problem solvers and emerging technologies, working together to unlock growth opportunities for organizations. Their innovative approach blends strategy, creativity, and cutting-edge solutions to drive impactful results.​We’re excited to host Brews & Bots @ SXSW '25 at their brand-new, state-of-the-art creative collaborative facility in Austin, TX. This inspiring space is designed to foster innovation, collaboration, and creativity—making it the perfect venue for connecting visionaries and showcasing the future of AI.​About Veracode, your Sponsor​Veracode is a global leader in Application Risk Management for the AI era. Powered by trillions of lines of code scans and a proprietary AI-assisted remediation engine, the Veracode platform offers adaptive software security and is trusted by organizations worldwide to build and maintain secure software from code creation to cloud deployment.Location3901 Woodbury DrAustin, TX 78704, USAThe Next PracticesPresented bySightboxSubscribeVision for venture.Hosted ByCharlie HinojosaCynthia HinojosaDakota Moore279 GoingRodrigo Paredes, Austin Langley and 277 othersContact the HostReport EventAIWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: Industry Journalists Tell All
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byUKAEG @ SXSWSubscribeHosted ByUK AdvertisingAisling Conlon49 GoingGabrielle Pitman, Lida and 47 othersContact the HostReport EventFeatured in SXSWIndustry Journalists Tell AllUKAEG @ SXSWPalm Door On SixthAustin, TexasRegistrationWelcome! To join the event, please register below. RegisterYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​Ever wondered what makes a story unmissable in the eyes of top industry journalists? In this exclusive conversation curated for SXSW, media insiders from Axios, and AdWeek, reveal how they choose which trends to cover, which voices to amplify, and what separates a standout pitch from the hundreds they receive daily.​Whether you’re a brand, startup, or agency, this is your chance to get an insider’s perspective on crafting stories that cut through the noise, securing media coverage that matters, and avoiding the common mistakes that keep great ideas off the page.​Speakers:​​Kathryn Lundstrom, Commerce and Sustainability Editor, AdWeek​Kerry Flynn, Media Reporter, Axios​​Mary Cirincione,  Managing Director, U.S, Propeller Group​Make sure to follow UK Advertising on LinkedIn and check our website to stay updated on our other events, exclusive giveaways, and surprise pop-ups throughout SXSW.LocationPalm Door On Sixth508 E 6th St, Austin, TX 78701, USAPresented byUKAEG @ SXSWSubscribeHosted ByUK AdvertisingAisling Conlon49 GoingGabrielle Pitman, Lida and 47 othersContact the HostReport EventWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: The Attention Economy: How to Entertain in 2025
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byUKAEG @ SXSWSubscribeHosted ByUK AdvertisingAisling Conlon80 GoingOleksii Avramenko, Lida and 78 othersContact the HostReport EventFeatured in SXSWThe Attention Economy: How to Entertain in 2025UKAEG @ SXSWPalm Door On SixthAustin, TexasRegistrationWelcome! To join the event, please register below. RegisterYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​A handful of brands are dominating culture, stealing share of voice, and turning earned media into brand fame. But what’s their secret? Does every brand need to entertain to stay relevant, or is it just another marketing buzzword? In a world where attention is currency, some brands thrive while others fade. This session cuts through the noise to debate whether brands should create culture or stop chasing trends—and what brand fame really means.​Speakers:​​Dan Salkey, Co-Founder & Strategy Partner, Small World​​Lindsey Camell, Partnerships & Location Based Experiences, Hasbro​​Claire Nance , Head of Global Gaming Business Success Strategy at Activision Blizzard Media​​John Ludeke, SVP of Global Marketing, Dr. Squatch​​Make sure to follow UK Advertising on LinkedIn and check our website to stay updated on our other events, exclusive giveaways, and surprise pop-ups throughout SXSW.LocationPalm Door On Sixth508 E 6th St, Austin, TX 78701, USAPresented byUKAEG @ SXSWSubscribeHosted ByUK AdvertisingAisling Conlon80 GoingOleksii Avramenko, Lida and 78 othersContact the HostReport EventWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: From Storytelling to Storyselling - The Commercial Power of Narrative
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byUKAEG @ SXSWSubscribeHosted ByUK AdvertisingAisling Conlon58 GoingGabrielle Pitman, Lida and 56 othersContact the HostReport EventArts & CultureFeatured in SXSWFrom Storytelling to Storyselling - The Commercial Power of NarrativeUKAEG @ SXSWPalm Door On SixthAustin, TexasRegistrationWelcome! To join the event, please register below. RegisterYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​What do a 60-year-old English university, a tech disruptor, and a global brand strategist have in common? The power of narrative. In a world oversaturated with content, stories don’t just need to be told—they need to drive action. But what makes a narrative commercially powerful? Is it the art of emotional connection, the science of data, or the magic of cultural timing? Bringing together voices from academia, technology, and advertising, this debate will challenge conventional wisdom on how stories shape behaviour, influence industries, and create real value  to turn storytelling into storyselling. With Hey Human, The University of Warwick, and Future+​Speakers:​​Satnam Rana-Grindley, Director of Communications - University of Warwick​​Neil Davidson, CEO - HeyHuman​​​Ashumi Sanghvi, Founder - Future+ (Moderator)​Make sure to follow UK Advertising on LinkedIn and check our website to stay updated on our other events, exclusive giveaways, and surprise pop-ups throughout SXSW.LocationPalm Door On Sixth508 E 6th St, Austin, TX 78701, USAPresented byUKAEG @ SXSWSubscribeHosted ByUK AdvertisingAisling Conlon58 GoingGabrielle Pitman, Lida and 56 othersContact the HostReport EventArts & CultureWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: East Meets West: CREATORPALOOZA 2025 in ATX
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byCreator Economy NYCSubscribeThe premier hub connecting thousands of content creators and creator economy professionals through in-person events and insightful media.Hosted ByBrett DashevskyJames Del, PassionfruitTeachableBay Area Creator Economy CommunityShira LazarContact the HostReport EventFeatured in SXSWEast Meets West: CREATORPALOOZA 2025 in ATXCreator Economy NYCRegister to See AddressAustin, TexasRegistrationApproval RequiredYour registration is subject to approval by the host.Welcome! To join the event, please register below. Request to JoinYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​We're baaaaaack!​AUSTIN, we’re bringing the ultimate creator meetup to SXSW for the second year in a row with our friends from both coasts! ​Join Passionfruit, Creator Economy NYC, Bay Area Creator Economy, Teachable, What's Trending, SAG and more for a full day of networking, programming, and good vibes with creative people.​Expect insightful conversations, epic connections, and a party to cap it all off. Whether you’re here to learn, meet fellow creators, or just recharge, we got you.​🔥 What’s Happening? (exact schedule to come)​A Conversation with Shira Lazar (What's Trending)​Deep dive discussions hosted by Rachel Masters (Masters Collective, Bay Area Creator Economy)​Panel hosted by Brett Dashevsky (Creator Economy NYC, Kickstarter)​Creators with Disabilities Meet-Up (Liz Plank & Not So Special)​Headshots + Charging Station from Teachable (Stay powered up & looking fresh)​Live DJ & Dance Party (Because SXSW isn’t SXSW without a party)​🗺️ When & Where?​IYKYK @ Inn Cahoots: 1221 E 6th St, Austin, TX 78702​Sunday, March 9​2 PM - 8 PM (or later!)​Pull up, meet your people, and let’s make some magic. ​RSVP now & arrive early, entry is subject to capacity! 🚀​Who are we?​The Daily Dot launched Passionfruit as a newsletter in 2022 with the belief that too much "creator economy" coverage was focused on the "economy" and not the creative labor that goes into making it an economy.​​Have a news tip for our editors? tips@passionfru.it​​​​​​​​​​Creator Economy NYC is the premier hub connecting thousands of content creators and creator economy professionals through in-person events and insightful media.​​​​​Follow us on Linkedin & Instagram.​​Teachable is where seasoned creators around the world build their legacy through education. On Teachable, it’s easy to create high-quality courses, coaching, memberships, and digital downloads that help creators scale their businesses — and truly impact people's lives.​​With tools designed to grow revenue and drive deeper engagement, creators can confidently move towards real financial freedom, while delivering a learning experience their audience loves.​​Learn more at teachable.com.​The Bay Area Creator Economy is a new community organization designed to serve the creators and creator economy industry professionals who reside in the San Francisco Bay Area and anyone else that is interested in connecting with this community. Follow on LinkedIn!​​What’s Trending is an independent media brand that curates and covers the most viral and shareable content across the social web. Launched in 2011 by award-winning host, journalist, and digital personality Shira Lazar, it has grown into a trusted destination for entertainment and digital culture.​​SAG-AFTRA represents approximately 160,000 actors, announcers, broadcast journalists, dancers, DJs, news writers, news editors, program hosts, puppeteers, recording artists, singers, stunt performers, voiceover artists and other media professionals.​Disclaimers:​*RSVP acceptance is not guaranteed.​**By signing up for the event you will also be subscribed to our partners' newsletters for future event updates & promotions.​​​​​***This event will be photographed, and all sponsors & partners reserve the right to use photos and video from the event for marketing and communications purposes. By attending the event, you consent to the use of your image for these purposes.​LocationPlease register to see the exact location of this event.Austin, TexasPresented byCreator Economy NYCSubscribeThe premier hub connecting thousands of content creators and creator economy professionals through in-person events and insightful media.Hosted ByBrett DashevskyJames Del, PassionfruitTeachableBay Area Creator Economy CommunityShira LazarContact the HostReport EventWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: From Touchdowns to Goals: Texas, the World Cup, and the Future of Football
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byUKAEG @ SXSWSubscribeHosted ByUK AdvertisingAisling Conlon45 GoingJan-Luc Blakborn, Luis Linan and 43 othersContact the HostReport EventFitnessFeatured in SXSWFrom Touchdowns to Goals: Texas, the World Cup, and the Future of FootballUKAEG @ SXSWPalm Door On SixthAustin, TexasRegistrationApproval RequiredYour registration is subject to approval by the host.Welcome! To join the event, please register below. Request to JoinYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​An Exclusive Event for Brand Marketing and Sports Leaders.Texas doesn’t just host events—it builds legacies. With the 2026 FIFA World Cup on the horizon, the Lone Star State is stepping onto the global stage as a major sports hub.​But how can this moment be leveraged to grow the game, expand fan bases, and create lasting impact?​Major events do more than draw crowds—they shape the future. From soccer to rugby to American football, the UK and USA have much to learn from each other. This event brings together industry leaders to explore how Texas can redefine its place in the sports world and surpass traditional markets like New York and Los Angeles.​AGENDA​Bridging the Game: Texas’ Playbook for Hosting the WorldSpeaker: 🎤 Janis Burke, Former CEO, Harris County - Houston Sports Authority​From Touchdowns to Goals: Texas, the World Cup, and the Future of Football Texas is gearing up to take center stage for the FIFA World Cup, playing a pivotal role in shaping soccer’s future in the U.S.​But what will it take to cement Texas as the beating heart of the sport—both on and off the pitch?​Join UK Advertising and the American Advertising Federation for an exclusive panel featuring industry leaders from both sides of the Atlantic. Together, we’ll uncover the strategies that will define Texas’ World Cup moment—and its lasting impact on the sport’s future in the U.S.Speakers:🎤 Megan Lindon – Senior Director, Brand & Merchandise, Austin FC🎤 SJ Luedtke – CMO, Houston Dynamo🎤 Michelle Tierney – Chief Revenue Officer, B-Engaged🎤 Beth Johnson – Co-Founder, Umbrella🎤 Moderator: Nate Thompson – Co-Founder, HTX Sports Tech​Game Plan: Turning Insights into Action Go beyond the conversation with interactive breakout discussions designed to spark meaningful connections between U.S. and UK industry leaders.​Join us for The Sunday Roast at 2pm as our guest. - food, drink and entertainment by a special guest provided. ​SPEAKERS ​​Sorcha Gordon, Co-Founder T.E.A.M Houston, AAF Houston – Programs Chair​Megan Lindon – Senior Director, Brand & Merchandise, Austin FC​​SJ Luedtke – CMO, Houston Dynamo​​Michelle Tierney – Chief Revenue Officer, B-Engaged​​Beth Johnson – Co-Founder, Umbrella​​Nate Thompson, Co-Founder, HTX Sports Tech​Expect insider insights on:Unlocking cross-market opportunitiesHarnessing sports’ influence to drive brand growthInnovating in fan engagement​Who Should Attend?Brand and Marketing Leaders looking to harness the power of sports for audience engagementSports Executives & Team Representatives keen on expanding their reach in new marketsHost City Officials & Event Organizers preparing for major sporting events and looking to maximize their long-term impactMedia & Sponsorship Professionals exploring opportunities in the evolving sports landscapeBusiness Leaders & Investors interested in the commercial impact of the FIFA World Cup and beyond​Spots are limited—register now to be part of this exclusive discussion.​Make sure to follow UK Advertising on LinkedIn and check our website to stay updated on our other events, exclusive giveaways, and surprise pop-ups throughout SXSW.LocationPalm Door On Sixth508 E 6th St, Austin, TX 78701, USAPresented byUKAEG @ SXSWSubscribeHosted ByUK AdvertisingAisling Conlon45 GoingJan-Luc Blakborn, Luis Linan and 43 othersContact the HostReport EventFitnessWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: London Calling - A New York Times Must Visit Hub in 2025 Fueled by Creativity & Innovation
content: Explore EventsSign InHosted ByStephen FelineJames CummingsHaly Brill Jemma HottaPaul WebsterMederic DemouchyContact the HostReport EventFeatured in SXSWLondon Calling - A New York Times Must Visit Hub in 2025 Fueled by Creativity & InnovationHosted by Stephen Feline & 5 othersRegister to See AddressAustin, TexasRegistrationApproval RequiredYour registration is subject to approval by the host.Welcome! To join the event, please register below. Request to JoinYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​Join us for 'London Calling: Where pioneering ideas meet business opportunities' - an exclusive networking event designed for innovative businesses and investors looking to explore investment opportunities in London and the UK.​This event, hosted by Here East, London & Partners, and Oury Clark will offer a chance to connect with entrepreneurs, disruptors, and thought leaders who will showcase why London is Europe’s core hub for tech, financial services, creative and climate industries, as well as transatlantic connections and how you can be a part of it.​Recently labeled by the New York Times as one of their 52 Places to Go in 2025, attendees can learn the importance of the London business dynamic directly from Stephen Feline, Director of North America of London & Partners, Gavin Poole, CEO of Here East, with additional speakers to come!​Sunday, 9 March 2025 4:00-7:00 pm CST​Hotel ZaZa Austin | 400 Lavaca Street Austin, TX 78701 United States​Why Attend?​Tailored Connections: Network with peers and experts in an atmosphere that embodies the spirit of Here East, London’s catalyst for business innovation and collaboration.​Strategic Networking: Engage with a curated group of UK and international businesses, leaders, investors, and innovators.​Explore Partnerships: Discover potential partnerships and collaborative opportunities with UK-based companies and institutions. 2025 in particular will be a big year for the UK-Texas connection with SXSW also kicking off in London for the first time in June 2025! ​Who Should Attend?​Entrepreneurs, CEOs, investors, and decision-makers from companies considering expansion or investment in the UK, particularly in technology, finance, creative industries, and more.​Registration:​Capacity at this event is limited, and we are keen to reserve spaces for organizations we are best placed to support. To apply to attend, please use this registration link and someone will be in contact with you to confirm your place.​About Here East:​Here East is London’s fastest growing innovation campus and has been recognised by the International Olympic Committee as one of the most successful post-Olympic regeneration projects in the world. It is home to 6,500 people who work and study onsite, from global technology companies and start-ups to major academic institutions and industry leaders in the creative arts.​About London & Partners:​London & Partners are London’s economic development and tourism agency. Every year, they help 300+ London companies expand into new international markets and 150+ companies from around the world launch in London.​About Oury Clark​Oury Clark is a very unique firm of chartered accountants and solicitors that assist UK and overseas businesses, individuals and entrepreneurs with all of their UK, tax and accounting needs. Oury Clark is at the forefront of helping US business expand into the UK.​By registering for London Calling you provide consent that all information provided on the registration form, name and contact information, will be shared with Here East, London & Partners, and Oury Clark for the purposes of this event.LocationPlease register to see the exact location of this event.Austin, TexasHosted ByStephen FelineJames CummingsHaly Brill Jemma HottaPaul WebsterMederic DemouchyContact the HostReport EventWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

content: Explore EventsSign InHosted ByEmily FangGrace LingDesign BuddiesJerry WonDaryl PngMegumi Calver62 GoingAri Krzyzek, Anh L. Learn about them:​​Singapore Global Network (SGN)If you are curious to meet like minded people globally, join SGN's online vibrant community here today. By joining their network, you connect with a 130,000-strong community of professionals and friends seeking to deepen connections in Singapore and across the globe. ​​​​​🙌🏻 To learn or collab with SGN, email Emily at emily_fang@singaporeglobalnetwork.sg ​Design Buddies​Design Buddies/UXGO is a community where you level up your design career. Land jobs, improve your design skills, and make friends. We have resources, events, design challenges, job boards, fun perks, and more. name: Lumos House VIP Founder Dinner
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byLumos House @ Austin 2025SubscribeAn invite-only event series for the most visionary founders, builders, and leaders in media & tech. Powered by Blindspot and Andrew Yeung, set in an exclusive mansion—free to attend.Hosted ByAndrew YeungBogdan SavoneaMatei PsattaSeba DominguezAgree.comWill Hubbard23 GoingNia Pryce, Cliff Lerner and 21 othersContact the HostReport EventFeatured in SXSWLumos House VIP Founder DinnerLumos House @ Austin 2025Register to See AddressAustin, TexasRegistrationWelcome! Please choose your desired ticket type:General​Require Approval VIP​Require Approval Friends of Andrew and Blindspot, please apply here.Request to JoinYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​​​LUMOS HOUSE Presents:​The Founder’s Table: VIP Dinner​An evening reserved for the boldest minds in tech and business—The Founder’s Table is an intimate VIP dinner for founders, investors, and industry leaders who move the needle. Set in a private mansion, this is where real conversations happen, deals take shape, and the future gets mapped out over world-class cuisine.​​What is this?: Part of the invite-only event series, Lumos House, The Founder’s Table is an exclusive dinner for Lumos House’s prominent CEOs, founders, and investors. Guests will enjoy a taste of Austin's most savory cuisine.Where is this?: This event is taking place at a luxe Austin property during SXSW 2025.Who's attending?: A curated list of notable technology founders, investors, and leaders in media and entertainment.*We appreciate your patience as Lumos House carefully selects attendees from over 1,000+ RSVPs.​About our Hosts & Sponsors:​​​Andrew Yeung is the founder of Fibe (a portfolio of events companies including Andrew's Mixers, The Junto Series, and Lumos House). He is also a Partner at Next Wave NYC, a pre-seed/seed found backed by Flybridge Capital. Andrew's hosted 100+ events for 30k+ tech founders and professionals in 8 cities that were featured in Bloomberg, Business Insider, Fast Company, and Fortune Magazine. Business Insider dubbed him the "Gatsby of Silicon Alley."​​​​​​​Get on the list for future events: Twitter • Instagram • Website​​Blindspot is an open and transparent platform making digital out-of-home advertising flexible and accessible to any business in the world. Over 1.000.000 digital billboards are accessible through Blindspot, with campaigns starting as low as $2. The platform is being used by over 12.000 advertisers, from SMBs to startups and household names such as Rihanna, Airbnb, Snoop Dogg, American Airlines, United Nations, Morning Brew, Universal Music, Samsung, TikTok and more. Learn more here.Builders is an AI-powered talent platform connecting US companies with top LATAM tech talent—sourcing, vetting, and managing payroll seamlessly.​​Agree.com is giving away free e-signature to everyone, with integrated invoicing and payments. Today is the last day you'll ever pay for DocuSign! And, for all attendees of the Lumos House this year at SXSW, Agree™ is upgrading everyone's account to a "Teams" plan free for a year. Book a demo today and we'll even waive the first three months of any transaction fees. Book a demo now.​LocationPlease register to see the exact location of this event.Austin, TexasPresented byLumos House @ Austin 2025SubscribeAn invite-only event series for the most visionary founders, builders, and leaders in media & tech. Powered by Blindspot and Andrew Yeung, set in an exclusive mansion—free to attend.Hosted ByAndrew YeungBogdan SavoneaMatei PsattaSeba DominguezAgree.comWill Hubbard23 GoingNia Pryce, Cliff Lerner and 21 othersContact the HostReport EventWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: [SXSW] Not-Your-Regular-Meetup : Build Your Village
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byFounders, Funders, & FractionalsSubscribeFounders, Funders, & Fractionals is dedicated to enhancing the startup ecosystem by promoting the strategic use of fractional talent and creating high-ROI experiences through education and networking.Hosted ByAshley JeffersonPatricia Lopez110 GoingAnette Armenta, Zack Pennington and 108 othersContact the HostReport EventFeatured in SXSW[SXSW] Not-Your-Regular-Meetup : Build Your VillageFounders, Funders, & FractionalsRegister to See AddressAustin, TexasRegistrationWelcome! Please choose your desired ticket type:Founder​Require Approval Only choose this ticket if: You are the Founder of a non-service-based business (i.e., not consulting).Funder​Require Approval Only choose this ticket if: You are an active Angel, VC, or Institutional InvestorFractional​Require Approval Only choose this ticket if: You are an active/aspiring FractionalRequest to JoinYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​Ever wonder why some founders & investors seem to have all the right connections?​Perfect for: Founders, investors, and fractional leaders ready to build their support system.​The Format: ​6:00 - Mix & mingle ​6:30 - Power panel + Q&A ​7:00 - Structured networking (the good kind)​8: 00 - Event ends, see you next time!​Join us for 2 hours that could transform your network. You'll hear from community leaders who've built success through relationships, then participate in structured networking that actually works. No awkward small talk - just real connections with people who can help you grow.​Panel:​Lidija Newman - Austin Community Leader​Chris Palmisano - Go-to-Market Executive​Joel Granoff - Fractional Growth Executive​Andrew Abraham - Venture Associate​Moderated by:​Patty Lopez - Fractional HR & Talent​Ashley Jefferson - Creator, F3​Register here and tell us a little bit more about yourself so we can curate the event for the guest list.LocationPlease register to see the exact location of this event.Austin, TexasPresented byFounders, Funders, & FractionalsSubscribeFounders, Funders, & Fractionals is dedicated to enhancing the startup ecosystem by promoting the strategic use of fractional talent and creating high-ROI experiences through education and networking.Hosted ByAshley JeffersonPatricia Lopez110 GoingAnette Armenta, Zack Pennington and 108 othersContact the HostReport EventWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: Connecting the Americas | During SXSW | Special Brazil Edition
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byConnecting the AmericasSubscribeContact the HostReport EventAIFeatured in SXSWConnecting the Americas | During SXSW | Special Brazil EditionConnecting the AmericasFogo De Chao - AustinAustin, TexasRegistrationApproval RequiredYour registration is subject to approval by the host.Welcome! To join the event, please register below. Registration closes at  Request to JoinYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​The Place to Power Up, Connect, and Engage with Industry Pioneers​🌎 Connecting the Americas é uma oportunidade única para começar o dia com energia, ideias poderosas e inspiração para o que vem por aí no SXSW.​☕ Antes da tempestade, junte-se a um seleto grupo de visionários para um café da manhã exclusivo, onde as conexões acontecem e as discussões moldam o futuro.​🗣️Painel: Muito além do Hype da Inteligência Artificial : Aplicação Real no Mundo dos Negócio​💡 Um bate-papo direto com líderes que estão aplicando IA Generativa para transformar operações e criar vantagem competitiva nos mercados americano e global.​Conheça os Convidados Especiais: ​🔹 Leandro Balbinot CTO da Whole Foods Market. Antes, foi VP Sênior de Tecnologia Global no McDonald's e KraftHeinz, além de CIO das Lojas Renner. No Whole Foods, a IA está transformando todas as áreas do negócio, permitindo que a empresa invista mais tempo na experiência de clientes e colaboradores.​🔹 Liz BacelarHead de AI & Advanced Analytics na Under Armour. Antes, foi Executive Director Global Tech Innovation na The Estée Lauder Companies. Apaixonada por tornar tecnologias emergentes acessíveis e aplicáveis para consumidores e marcas, liderou a criação de um Laboratório de IA focado no desenvolvimento de soluções inovadoras.​🔹 Ricardo AlemLíder em inovação, transformação digital e GenAI. Na AWS, lidera o desenvolvimento de mercado de IA Generativa e Machine Learning para o Brasil e América Latina. Palestrante em eventos globais como Singularity, re:Invent, AI Bootcamp e HSM Expo.​🔹 Alberto SilveiraCTO da HireVue, empresa do The Carlyle Group. Autor do livro Building and Managing High-Performance Distributed Teams, lidera uma plataforma que já realizou mais de 26 milhões de entrevistas em vídeo e 5 milhões de avaliações com IA para mais de 700 clientes ao redor do mundo.​🔹Antonio Alves​Fundador da Auramind.ai e Infomach, além de Vice Presidente do Cultura Brasil Austin (CBA). Viciado em pickleball, é sócio e investidor em startups e negócios tradicionais. Está à frente de iniciativas que impulsionam tecnologia, inovação e conexões.​🤝 Mais do que um espectador, participe ativamente da conversa. Compartilhe suas perspectivas e insights em um debate estratégico sobre o impacto real da IA nos negócios.​🎤 Interaja diretamente com os speakers e aproveite essa oportunidade para trocar experiências de alto nível.​Registre-se Agora! Lugares limitado a capacidade da Fogo de Chäo. LocationFogo De Chao - Austin200 Congress Ave., Austin, TX 78701, USAPresented byConnecting the AmericasSubscribeContact the HostReport EventAIWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗

name: 2nd Annual SX Pitch and Run!🤠
content: Explore EventsSign InPresented byPitch and RunSubscribePitch and Run was founded to make it easy for founders to connect with Angels and VCs without the pressure of a pitch meeting and to allow founders and startup employees to connect. Hosted ByZeke TorresKevin WeathermanKatelyn PostiglioneRyan Hess405 GoingMitchell Weller, Pranay Baid and 403 othersContact the HostReport EventFeatured in SXSW2nd Annual SX Pitch and Run!🤠Pitch and RunThe Loop Running SupplyAustin, TexasRegistrationWelcome! To join the event, please register below. RegisterYou will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.About Event​Pitch and Run ATX! 🤠​ALL ARE WELCOME - NO BADGE NEEDEDJoin us for our 2nd Annual SX Pitch and Run!!FREE COFFEE and some KINETICS SUNGLASSES to the FIRST EARLY BIRDS that show up! Bravo Sierra will also be there handing out body wipes to try, so we can all stay so fresh and so clean clean!​ABOUT US ​​Pitch and Run was founded to make it easy for founders to connect with Angels and VCs without the pressure of a pitch meeting and to allow founders and startup employees to connect with each other. Many companies have raised their round, found customers, their co-founders, and even sold their companies from connections made at Pitch and Run. Join us for a run! We meet every Friday 8AM at Merit Coffee on West Ave.​SPONSORS ​KnockaroundIs a leading eyewear brand known for offering high-quality, stylish and affordable sunglasses. Started in San Diego in 2005, Knockaround has built a reputation for blending durability and design, providing customers with practical eyewear that doesn’t compromise on performance. With a wide range of frame styles, colors and ongoing special releases, Knockaround offers something for everyone, including a comprehensive line of golf and sport-focused sunglasses.Bravo SierraEstablished in New York City in 2019, Bravo Sierra creates high-performance body care essentials. Our pH-balanced formulas are designed with potent bio-adaptive ingredients to keep skin hydrated and resilient while delivering exceptional scents and textures. A portion of every purchase supports U.S. military veterans. Engineered for precision. Crafted for experience. Made in the USA​The LOOPLocal running shop that has a heartbeat on the Austin running community. Specialist in shoe fitting and curating the premium running shoes, apparel, and accessories for all runners needs! ​Use code P&R15 at checkout for 15% off!​SCHEDULE​8:30AM - Early Birds get Knockaround glasses on us! ​9:00AM - Intros / Start Run​10:00AM - Run Ends / Hang out, chat and drink some free coffee! ​FOLLOW US​LinkedIn: @PitchandRunTwitter: @PitchandRunATXIG: @PitchandRunATX ​Ground Rules​Who: We are welcome to EVERYONE, founders, funders, employees of startups, fans of startups, etc! ALL paces welcomed! ​Intros: Your name, how long you've been doing PitchandRun and something good that happened this week!​Why: We're a community here to support each other in Life, Running, Fundraising, Career Moves, etc  - Pitch and Run is about supporting each other!​We are building a community of people (not companies) you can talk about your company on the run but we want people to join as the person not what they are starting or what they do for a living.​#PitchandRunATX #startups #investors #founders #vc #entrepreneurs #running #atx #austin #SXSW LocationThe Loop Running Supply115 Sandra Muraida Way Ste 105B, Austin, TX 78703, USAPark in the parking garage. We will validate your ticket on the way out!Presented byPitch and RunSubscribePitch and Run was founded to make it easy for founders to connect with Angels and VCs without the pressure of a pitch meeting and to allow founders and startup employees to connect. Hosted ByZeke TorresKevin WeathermanKatelyn PostiglioneRyan Hess405 GoingMitchell Weller, Pranay Baid and 403 othersContact the HostReport EventWhat's NewDiscoverPricingHelpHost your event with Luma ↗
